            <h1>The Second Part of Henry the Sixth</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">

                           </span>

                     </ul>
                  </li>

         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING HENRY the Sixth</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HUMPHREY, Duke of Gloucester, his uncle. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CARDINAL BEAUFORT, Bishop of Winchester, great-uncle to the King.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">RICHARD PLANTAGENET, Duke of York. </span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">EDWARD</span>
                        <span class="personname">RICHARD</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">his sons</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF SOMERSET</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF SUFFOLK</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF BUCKINGHAM</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD CLIFFORD</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">YOUNG CLIFFORD, his son.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF SALISBURY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF WARWICK</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD SCALES</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD SAY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR HUMPHREY STAFFORD</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">WILLIAM STAFFORD, Sir Humphrey Stafford's brother.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR JOHN STANLEY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">VAUX</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MATTHEW GOFFE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Sea-captain, Master, and Master's-Mate.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">WALTER WHITMORE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Two Gentlemen, prisoners with Suffolk.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">JOHN HUME </span>
                        <span class="personname">JOHN SOUTHWELL</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">priests.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BOLINGBROKE, a conjurer.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">THOMAS HORNER, an armourer. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PETER, Thomas Horner's man.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Clerk of Chatham. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Mayor of Saint Alban's. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIMPCOX, an impostor.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ALEXANDER IDEN, a Kentish gentleman. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">JACK CADE, a rebel. </span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">GEORGE BEVIS</span>
                        <span class="personname">JOHN HOLLAND</span>
                        <span class="personname">DICK the butcher</span>
                        <span class="personname">SMITH the weaver</span>
                        <span class="personname">MICHAEL</span>
                        <span class="personname">&c.</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">followers of Cade.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Two Murderers</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">QUEEN MARGARET, Queen to King Henry.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ELEANOR, Duchess of Gloucester. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MARGARET JOURDAIN, a witch.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Wife to Simpcox  </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Ladies, and Attendants. Petitioners, Aldermen, a Herald, a Beadle, Sheriff, and Officers, Citizens, 'Prentices, Falconers, Guards, Soldiers, Messengers, &c.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Spirit. </span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  England.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  GLOUCESTER'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  GLOUCESTER's garden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish of trumpets: then hautboys. Enter KING
HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and
CARDINAL, on the one side; QUEEN MARGARET, SUFFOLK,
YORK, SOMERSET, and BUCKINGHAM, on the other</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">As by your high imperial majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">I had in charge at my depart for France,</div>
                     <div class="line">As procurator to your excellence,</div>
                     <div class="line">To marry Princess Margaret for your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">So, in the famous ancient city, Tours,</div>
                     <div class="line">In presence of the Kings of France and Sicil,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Dukes of Orleans, Calaber, Bretagne and Alencon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seven earls, twelve barons and twenty reverend bishops,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have perform'd my task and was espoused:</div>
                     <div class="line">And humbly now upon my bended knee,</div>
                     <div class="line">In sight of England and her lordly peers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver up my title in the queen</div>
                     <div class="line">To your most gracious hands, that are the substance</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that great shadow I did represent;</div>
                     <div class="line">The happiest gift that ever marquess gave,</div>
                     <div class="line">The fairest queen that ever king received.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Suffolk, arise. Welcome, Queen Margaret:</div>
                     <div class="line">I can express no kinder sign of love</div>
                     <div class="line">Than this kind kiss. O Lord, that lends me life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lend me a heart replete with thankfulness!</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou hast given me in this beauteous face</div>
                     <div class="line">A world of earthly blessings to my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">If sympathy of love unite our thoughts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Great King of England and my gracious lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mutual conference that my mind hath had,</div>
                     <div class="line">By day, by night, waking and in my dreams,</div>
                     <div class="line">In courtly company or at my beads,</div>
                     <div class="line">With you, mine alder-liefest sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes me the bolder to salute my king</div>
                     <div class="line">With ruder terms, such as my wit affords</div>
                     <div class="line">And over-joy of heart doth minister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Her sight did ravish; but her grace in speech,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her words y-clad with wisdom's majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes me from wondering fall to weeping joys;</div>
                     <div class="line">Such is the fulness of my heart's content.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lords, with one cheerful voice welcome my love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Kneeling</span>  Long live Queen Margaret, England's</div>
                     <div class="line">happiness!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">We thank you all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord protector, so it please your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here are the articles of contracted peace</div>
                     <div class="line">Between our sovereign and the French king Charles,</div>
                     <div class="line">For eighteen months concluded by consent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Imprimis, it is agreed between the French</div>
                     <div class="line">king Charles, and William de la Pole, Marquess of</div>
                     <div class="line">Suffolk, ambassador for Henry King of England, that</div>
                     <div class="line">the said Henry shall espouse the Lady Margaret,</div>
                     <div class="line">daughter unto Reignier King of Naples, Sicilia and</div>
                     <div class="line">Jerusalem, and crown her Queen of England ere the</div>
                     <div class="line">thirtieth of May next ensuing. Item, that the duchy</div>
                     <div class="line">of Anjou and the county of Maine shall be released</div>
                     <div class="line">and delivered to the king her father'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Lets the paper fall</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, how now!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, gracious lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some sudden qualm hath struck me at the heart</div>
                     <div class="line">And dimm'd mine eyes, that I can read no further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle of Winchester, I pray, read on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Item, It is further agreed between them,</div>
                     <div class="line">that the duchies of Anjou and Maine shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">released and delivered over to the king her father,</div>
                     <div class="line">and she sent over of the King of England's own</div>
                     <div class="line">proper cost and charges, without having any dowry.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">They please us well. Lord marquess, kneel down:</div>
                     <div class="line">We here create thee the first duke of Suffolk,</div>
                     <div class="line">And gird thee with the sword. Cousin of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">We here discharge your grace from being regent</div>
                     <div class="line">I' the parts of France, till term of eighteen months</div>
                     <div class="line">Be full expired. Thanks, uncle Winchester,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gloucester, York, Buckingham, Somerset,</div>
                     <div class="line">Salisbury, and Warwick;</div>
                     <div class="line">We thank you all for the great favour done,</div>
                     <div class="line">In entertainment to my princely queen.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let us in, and with all speed provide</div>
                     <div class="line">To see her coronation be perform'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt KING HENRY VI, QUEEN MARGARET, and SUFFOLK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Brave peers of England, pillars of the state,</div>
                     <div class="line">To you Duke Humphrey must unload his grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grief, the common grief of all the land.</div>
                     <div class="line">What! did my brother Henry spend his youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">His valour, coin and people, in the wars?</div>
                     <div class="line">Did he so often lodge in open field,</div>
                     <div class="line">In winter's cold and summer's parching heat,</div>
                     <div class="line">To conquer France, his true inheritance?</div>
                     <div class="line">And did my brother Bedford toil his wits,</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep by policy what Henry got?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you yourselves, Somerset, Buckingham,</div>
                     <div class="line">Brave York, Salisbury, and victorious Warwick,</div>
                     <div class="line">Received deep scars in France and Normandy?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or hath mine uncle Beaufort and myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all the learned council of the realm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Studied so long, sat in the council-house</div>
                     <div class="line">Early and late, debating to and fro</div>
                     <div class="line">How France and Frenchmen might be kept in awe,</div>
                     <div class="line">And had his highness in his infancy</div>
                     <div class="line">Crowned in Paris in despite of foes?</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall these labours and these honours die?</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall Henry's conquest, Bedford's vigilance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your deeds of war and all our counsel die?</div>
                     <div class="line">O peers of England, shameful is this league!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fatal this marriage, cancelling your fame,</div>
                     <div class="line">Blotting your names from books of memory,</div>
                     <div class="line">Razing the characters of your renown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Defacing monuments of conquer'd France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Undoing all, as all had never been!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">Nephew, what means this passionate discourse,</div>
                     <div class="line">This peroration with such circumstance?</div>
                     <div class="line">For France, 'tis ours; and we will keep it still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, uncle, we will keep it, if we can;</div>
                     <div class="line">But now it is impossible we should:</div>
                     <div class="line">Suffolk, the new-made duke that rules the roast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath given the duchy of Anjou and Maine</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the poor King Reignier, whose large style</div>
                     <div class="line">Agrees not with the leanness of his purse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the death of Him that died for all,</div>
                     <div class="line">These counties were the keys of Normandy.</div>
                     <div class="line">But wherefore weeps Warwick, my valiant son?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">For grief that they are past recovery:</div>
                     <div class="line">For, were there hope to conquer them again,</div>
                     <div class="line">My sword should shed hot blood, mine eyes no tears.</div>
                     <div class="line">Anjou and Maine! myself did win them both;</div>
                     <div class="line">Those provinces these arms of mine did conquer:</div>
                     <div class="line">And are the cities, that I got with wounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Delivered up again with peaceful words?</div>
                     <div class="line">Mort Dieu!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">For Suffolk's duke, may he be suffocate,</div>
                     <div class="line">That dims the honour of this warlike isle!</div>
                     <div class="line">France should have torn and rent my very heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before I would have yielded to this league.</div>
                     <div class="line">I never read but England's kings have had</div>
                     <div class="line">Large sums of gold and dowries with their wives:</div>
                     <div class="line">And our King Henry gives away his own,</div>
                     <div class="line">To match with her that brings no vantages.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">A proper jest, and never heard before,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Suffolk should demand a whole fifteenth</div>
                     <div class="line">For costs and charges in transporting her!</div>
                     <div class="line">She should have stayed in France and starved</div>
                     <div class="line">in France, Before--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of Gloucester, now ye grow too hot:</div>
                     <div class="line">It was the pleasure of my lord the King.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of Winchester, I know your mind;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not my speeches that you do mislike,</div>
                     <div class="line">But 'tis my presence that doth trouble ye.</div>
                     <div class="line">Rancour will out: proud prelate, in thy face</div>
                     <div class="line">I see thy fury: if I longer stay,</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall begin our ancient bickerings.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lordings, farewell; and say, when I am gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">I prophesied France will be lost ere long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">So, there goes our protector in a rage.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis known to you he is mine enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, more, an enemy unto you all,</div>
                     <div class="line">And no great friend, I fear me, to the king.</div>
                     <div class="line">Consider, lords, he is the next of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And heir apparent to the English crown:</div>
                     <div class="line">Had Henry got an empire by his marriage,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the wealthy kingdoms of the west,</div>
                     <div class="line">There's reason he should be displeased at it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to it, lords! let not his smoothing words</div>
                     <div class="line">Bewitch your hearts; be wise and circumspect.</div>
                     <div class="line">What though the common people favour him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Calling him 'Humphrey, the good Duke of</div>
                     <div class="line">Gloucester,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Clapping their hands, and crying with loud voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Jesu maintain your royal excellence!'</div>
                     <div class="line">With 'God preserve the good Duke Humphrey!'</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear me, lords, for all this flattering gloss,</div>
                     <div class="line">He will be found a dangerous protector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should he, then, protect our sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">He being of age to govern of himself?</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin of Somerset, join you with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all together, with the Duke of Suffolk,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll quickly hoise Duke Humphrey from his seat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">This weighty business will not brook delay:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll to the Duke of Suffolk presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin of Buckingham, though Humphrey's pride</div>
                     <div class="line">And greatness of his place be grief to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet let us watch the haughty cardinal:</div>
                     <div class="line">His insolence is more intolerable</div>
                     <div class="line">Than all the princes in the land beside:</div>
                     <div class="line">If Gloucester be displaced, he'll be protector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Or thou or I, Somerset, will be protector,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despite Duke Humphrey or the cardinal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and SOMERSET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Pride went before, ambition follows him.</div>
                     <div class="line">While these do labour for their own preferment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Behoves it us to labour for the realm.</div>
                     <div class="line">I never saw but Humphrey Duke of Gloucester</div>
                     <div class="line">Did bear him like a noble gentleman.</div>
                     <div class="line">Oft have I seen the haughty cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">More like a soldier than a man o' the church,</div>
                     <div class="line">As stout and proud as he were lord of all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swear like a ruffian and demean himself</div>
                     <div class="line">Unlike the ruler of a commonweal.</div>
                     <div class="line">Warwick, my son, the comfort of my age,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy deeds, thy plainness and thy housekeeping,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath won the greatest favour of the commons,</div>
                     <div class="line">Excepting none but good Duke Humphrey:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, brother York, thy acts in Ireland,</div>
                     <div class="line">In bringing them to civil discipline,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy late exploits done in the heart of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou wert regent for our sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have made thee fear'd and honour'd of the people:</div>
                     <div class="line">Join we together, for the public good,</div>
                     <div class="line">In what we can, to bridle and suppress</div>
                     <div class="line">The pride of Suffolk and the cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">With Somerset's and Buckingham's ambition;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as we may, cherish Duke Humphrey's deeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">While they do tend the profit of the land.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">So God help Warwick, as he loves the land,</div>
                     <div class="line">And common profit of his country!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  And so says York, for he hath greatest cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let's make haste away, and look unto the main.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the main! O father, Maine is lost;</div>
                     <div class="line">That Maine which by main force Warwick did win,</div>
                     <div class="line">And would have kept so long as breath did last!</div>
                     <div class="line">Main chance, father, you meant; but I meant Maine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I will win from France, or else be slain,</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt WARWICK and SALISBURY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Anjou and Maine are given to the French;</div>
                     <div class="line">Paris is lost; the state of Normandy</div>
                     <div class="line">Stands on a tickle point, now they are gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">Suffolk concluded on the articles,</div>
                     <div class="line">The peers agreed, and Henry was well pleased</div>
                     <div class="line">To change two dukedoms for a duke's fair daughter.</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot blame them all: what is't to them?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis thine they give away, and not their own.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pirates may make cheap pennyworths of their pillage</div>
                     <div class="line">And purchase friends and give to courtezans,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still revelling like lords till all be gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">While as the silly owner of the goods</div>
                     <div class="line">Weeps over them and wrings his hapless hands</div>
                     <div class="line">And shakes his head and trembling stands aloof,</div>
                     <div class="line">While all is shared and all is borne away,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ready to starve and dare not touch his own:</div>
                     <div class="line">So York must sit and fret and bite his tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">While his own lands are bargain'd for and sold.</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks the realms of England, France and Ireland</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear that proportion to my flesh and blood</div>
                     <div class="line">As did the fatal brand Althaea burn'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the prince's heart of Calydon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Anjou and Maine both given unto the French!</div>
                     <div class="line">Cold news for me, for I had hope of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even as I have of fertile England's soil.</div>
                     <div class="line">A day will come when York shall claim his own;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore I will take the Nevils' parts</div>
                     <div class="line">And make a show of love to proud Duke Humphrey,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, when I spy advantage, claim the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">For that's the golden mark I seek to hit:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor shall proud Lancaster usurp my right,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor hold the sceptre in his childish fist,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor wear the diadem upon his head,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose church-like humours fits not for a crown.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, York, be still awhile, till time do serve:</div>
                     <div class="line">Watch thou and wake when others be asleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">To pry into the secrets of the state;</div>
                     <div class="line">Till Henry, surfeiting in joys of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">With his new bride and England's dear-bought queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Humphrey with the peers be fall'n at jars:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then will I raise aloft the milk-white rose,</div>
                     <div class="line">With whose sweet smell the air shall be perfumed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in my standard bear the arms of York</div>
                     <div class="line">To grapple with the house of Lancaster;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, force perforce, I'll make him yield the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose bookish rule hath pull'd fair England down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  GLOUCESTER'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GLOUCESTER and his DUCHESS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why droops my lord, like over-ripen'd corn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hanging the head at Ceres' plenteous load?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why doth the great Duke Humphrey knit his brows,</div>
                     <div class="line">As frowning at the favours of the world?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why are thine eyes fixed to the sullen earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gazing on that which seems to dim thy sight?</div>
                     <div class="line">What seest thou there? King Henry's diadem,</div>
                     <div class="line">Enchased with all the honours of the world?</div>
                     <div class="line">If so, gaze on, and grovel on thy face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until thy head be circled with the same.</div>
                     <div class="line">Put forth thy hand, reach at the glorious gold.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, is't too short? I'll lengthen it with mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, having both together heaved it up,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll both together lift our heads to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never more abase our sight so low</div>
                     <div class="line">As to vouchsafe one glance unto the ground.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">O Nell, sweet Nell, if thou dost love thy lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Banish the canker of ambitious thoughts.</div>
                     <div class="line">And may that thought, when I imagine ill</div>
                     <div class="line">Against my king and nephew, virtuous Henry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be my last breathing in this mortal world!</div>
                     <div class="line">My troublous dream this night doth make me sad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What dream'd my lord? tell me, and I'll requite it</div>
                     <div class="line">With sweet rehearsal of my morning's dream.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought this staff, mine office-badge in court,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was broke in twain; by whom I have forgot,</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as I think, it was by the cardinal;</div>
                     <div class="line">And on the pieces of the broken wand</div>
                     <div class="line">Were placed the heads of Edmund Duke of Somerset,</div>
                     <div class="line">And William de la Pole, first duke of Suffolk.</div>
                     <div class="line">This was my dream: what it doth bode, God knows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, this was nothing but an argument</div>
                     <div class="line">That he that breaks a stick of Gloucester's grove</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall lose his head for his presumption.</div>
                     <div class="line">But list to me, my Humphrey, my sweet duke:</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought I sat in seat of majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">In the cathedral church of Westminster,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in that chair where kings and queens are crown'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where Henry and dame Margaret kneel'd to me</div>
                     <div class="line">And on my head did set the diadem.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, Eleanor, then must I chide outright:</div>
                     <div class="line">Presumptuous dame, ill-nurtured Eleanor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou not second woman in the realm,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the protector's wife, beloved of him?</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou not worldly pleasure at command,</div>
                     <div class="line">Above the reach or compass of thy thought?</div>
                     <div class="line">And wilt thou still be hammering treachery,</div>
                     <div class="line">To tumble down thy husband and thyself</div>
                     <div class="line">From top of honour to disgrace's feet?</div>
                     <div class="line">Away from me, and let me hear no more!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, what, my lord! are you so choleric</div>
                     <div class="line">With Eleanor, for telling but her dream?</div>
                     <div class="line">Next time I'll keep my dreams unto myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not be cheque'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, be not angry; I am pleased again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord protector, 'tis his highness' pleasure</div>
                     <div class="line">You do prepare to ride unto Saint Alban's,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where as the king and queen do mean to hawk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I go. Come, Nell, thou wilt ride with us?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, my good lord, I'll follow presently.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt GLOUCESTER and Messenger</p>
                     <div class="line">Follow I must; I cannot go before,</div>
                     <div class="line">While Gloucester bears this base and humble mind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Were I a man, a duke, and next of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would remove these tedious stumbling-blocks</div>
                     <div class="line">And smooth my way upon their headless necks;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, being a woman, I will not be slack</div>
                     <div class="line">To play my part in Fortune's pageant.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where are you there? Sir John! nay, fear not, man,</div>
                     <div class="line">We are alone; here's none but thee and I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HUME</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUME</div>
                     <div class="line">Jesus preserve your royal majesty!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou? majesty! I am but grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUME</div>
                     <div class="line">But, by the grace of God, and Hume's advice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace's title shall be multiplied.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou, man? hast thou as yet conferr'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With Margery Jourdain, the cunning witch,</div>
                     <div class="line">With Roger Bolingbroke, the conjurer?</div>
                     <div class="line">And will they undertake to do me good?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUME</div>
                     <div class="line">This they have promised, to show your highness</div>
                     <div class="line">A spirit raised from depth of under-ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall make answer to such questions</div>
                     <div class="line">As by your grace shall be propounded him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is enough; I'll think upon the questions:</div>
                     <div class="line">When from St. Alban's we do make return,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll see these things effected to the full.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, Hume, take this reward; make merry, man,</div>
                     <div class="line">With thy confederates in this weighty cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUME</div>
                     <div class="line">Hume must make merry with the duchess' gold;</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, and shall. But how now, Sir John Hume!</div>
                     <div class="line">Seal up your lips, and give no words but mum:</div>
                     <div class="line">The business asketh silent secrecy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dame Eleanor gives gold to bring the witch:</div>
                     <div class="line">Gold cannot come amiss, were she a devil.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet have I gold flies from another coast;</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare not say, from the rich cardinal</div>
                     <div class="line">And from the great and new-made Duke of Suffolk,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I do find it so; for to be plain,</div>
                     <div class="line">They, knowing Dame Eleanor's aspiring humour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have hired me to undermine the duchess</div>
                     <div class="line">And buz these conjurations in her brain.</div>
                     <div class="line">They say 'A crafty knave does need no broker;'</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet am I Suffolk and the cardinal's broker.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hume, if you take not heed, you shall go near</div>
                     <div class="line">To call them both a pair of crafty knaves.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, so it stands; and thus, I fear, at last</div>
                     <div class="line">Hume's knavery will be the duchess' wreck,</div>
                     <div class="line">And her attainture will be Humphrey's fall:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sort how it will, I shall have gold for all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter three or four Petitioners, PETER, the
Armourer's man, being one</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Petitioner</div>
                     <div class="line">My masters, let's stand close: my lord protector</div>
                     <div class="line">will come this way by and by, and then we may deliver</div>
                     <div class="line">our supplications in the quill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Petitioner</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, the Lord protect him, for he's a good man!</div>
                     <div class="line">Jesu bless him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SUFFOLK and QUEEN MARGARET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Here a' comes, methinks, and the queen with him.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be the first, sure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Petitioner</div>
                     <div class="line">Come back, fool; this is the Duke of Suffolk, and</div>
                     <div class="line">not my lord protector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, fellow! would'st anything with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Petitioner</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray, my lord, pardon me; I took ye for my lord</div>
                     <div class="line">protector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reading</span>  'To my Lord Protector!' Are your</div>
                     <div class="line">supplications to his lordship? Let me see them:</div>
                     <div class="line">what is thine?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Petitioner</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine is, an't please your grace, against John</div>
                     <div class="line">Goodman, my lord cardinal's man, for keeping my</div>
                     <div class="line">house, and lands, and wife and all, from me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy wife, too! that's some wrong, indeed. What's</div>
                     <div class="line">yours? What's here!</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'Against the Duke of Suffolk, for enclosing the</div>
                     <div class="line">commons of Melford.' How now, sir knave!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Petitioner</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, sir, I am but a poor petitioner of our whole township.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Giving his petition</span>  Against my master, Thomas</div>
                     <div class="line">Horner, for saying that the Duke of York was rightful</div>
                     <div class="line">heir to the crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">What sayst thou? did the Duke of York say he was</div>
                     <div class="line">rightful heir to the crown?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">That my master was? no, forsooth: my master said</div>
                     <div class="line">that he was, and that the king was an usurper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is there?</div>
                     <p>Enter Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">Take this fellow in, and send for</div>
                     <div class="line">his master with a pursuivant presently: we'll hear</div>
                     <div class="line">more of your matter before the King.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Servant with PETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">And as for you, that love to be protected</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the wings of our protector's grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Begin your suits anew, and sue to him.</div>
                     <p>Tears the supplication</p>
                     <div class="line">Away, base cullions! Suffolk, let them go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let's be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of Suffolk, say, is this the guise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the fashion in the court of England?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the government of Britain's isle,</div>
                     <div class="line">And this the royalty of Albion's king?</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall King Henry be a pupil still</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the surly Gloucester's governance?</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I a queen in title and in style,</div>
                     <div class="line">And must be made a subject to a duke?</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee, Pole, when in the city Tours</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou ran'st a tilt in honour of my love</div>
                     <div class="line">And stolest away the ladies' hearts of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought King Henry had resembled thee</div>
                     <div class="line">In courage, courtship and proportion:</div>
                     <div class="line">But all his mind is bent to holiness,</div>
                     <div class="line">To number Ave-Maries on his beads;</div>
                     <div class="line">His champions are the prophets and apostles,</div>
                     <div class="line">His weapons holy saws of sacred writ,</div>
                     <div class="line">His study is his tilt-yard, and his loves</div>
                     <div class="line">Are brazen images of canonized saints.</div>
                     <div class="line">I would the college of the cardinals</div>
                     <div class="line">Would choose him pope, and carry him to Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">And set the triple crown upon his head:</div>
                     <div class="line">That were a state fit for his holiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, be patient: as I was cause</div>
                     <div class="line">Your highness came to England, so will I</div>
                     <div class="line">In England work your grace's full content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Beside the haughty protector, have we Beaufort,</div>
                     <div class="line">The imperious churchman, Somerset, Buckingham,</div>
                     <div class="line">And grumbling York: and not the least of these</div>
                     <div class="line">But can do more in England than the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">And he of these that can do most of all</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot do more in England than the Nevils:</div>
                     <div class="line">Salisbury and Warwick are no simple peers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Not all these lords do vex me half so much</div>
                     <div class="line">As that proud dame, the lord protector's wife.</div>
                     <div class="line">She sweeps it through the court with troops of ladies,</div>
                     <div class="line">More like an empress than Duke Humphrey's wife:</div>
                     <div class="line">Strangers in court do take her for the queen:</div>
                     <div class="line">She bears a duke's revenues on her back,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in her heart she scorns our poverty:</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I not live to be avenged on her?</div>
                     <div class="line">Contemptuous base-born callet as she is,</div>
                     <div class="line">She vaunted 'mongst her minions t'other day,</div>
                     <div class="line">The very train of her worst wearing gown</div>
                     <div class="line">Was better worth than all my father's lands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till Suffolk gave two dukedoms for his daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, myself have limed a bush for her,</div>
                     <div class="line">And placed a quire of such enticing birds,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she will light to listen to the lays,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never mount to trouble you again.</div>
                     <div class="line">So, let her rest: and, madam, list to me;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am bold to counsel you in this.</div>
                     <div class="line">Although we fancy not the cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet must we join with him and with the lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till we have brought Duke Humphrey in disgrace.</div>
                     <div class="line">As for the Duke of York, this late complaint</div>
                     <div class="line">Will make but little for his benefit.</div>
                     <div class="line">So, one by one, we'll weed them all at last,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you yourself shall steer the happy helm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Sound a sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER,
CARDINAL, BUCKINGHAM, YORK, SOMERSET, SALISBURY,
WARWICK, and the DUCHESS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">For my part, noble lords, I care not which;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or Somerset or York, all's one to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">If York have ill demean'd himself in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let him be denay'd the regentship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">If Somerset be unworthy of the place,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let York be regent; I will yield to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether your grace be worthy, yea or no,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dispute not that: York is the worthier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">Ambitious Warwick, let thy betters speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">The cardinal's not my better in the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">All in this presence are thy betters, Warwick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Warwick may live to be the best of all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, son! and show some reason, Buckingham,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why Somerset should be preferred in this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Because the king, forsooth, will have it so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, the king is old enough himself</div>
                     <div class="line">To give his censure: these are no women's matters.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">If he be old enough, what needs your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">To be protector of his excellence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I am protector of the realm;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, at his pleasure, will resign my place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Resign it then and leave thine insolence.</div>
                     <div class="line">Since thou wert king--as who is king but thou?--</div>
                     <div class="line">The commonwealth hath daily run to wreck;</div>
                     <div class="line">The Dauphin hath prevail'd beyond the seas;</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the peers and nobles of the realm</div>
                     <div class="line">Have been as bondmen to thy sovereignty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">The commons hast thou rack'd; the clergy's bags</div>
                     <div class="line">Are lank and lean with thy extortions.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy sumptuous buildings and thy wife's attire</div>
                     <div class="line">Have cost a mass of public treasury.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy cruelty in execution</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon offenders, hath exceeded law,</div>
                     <div class="line">And left thee to the mercy of the law.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">They sale of offices and towns in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">If they were known, as the suspect is great,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would make thee quickly hop without thy head.</div>
                     <p>Exit GLOUCESTER. QUEEN MARGARET drops her fan</p>
                     <div class="line">Give me my fan: what, minion! can ye not?</div>
                     <p>She gives the DUCHESS a box on the ear</p>
                     <div class="line">I cry you mercy, madam; was it you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Was't I! yea, I it was, proud Frenchwoman:</div>
                     <div class="line">Could I come near your beauty with my nails,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'd set my ten commandments in your face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet aunt, be quiet; 'twas against her will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Against her will! good king, look to't in time;</div>
                     <div class="line">She'll hamper thee, and dandle thee like a baby:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though in this place most master wear no breeches,</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall not strike Dame Eleanor unrevenged.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord cardinal, I will follow Eleanor,</div>
                     <div class="line">And listen after Humphrey, how he proceeds:</div>
                     <div class="line">She's tickled now; her fume needs no spurs,</div>
                     <div class="line">She'll gallop far enough to her destruction.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Re-enter GLOUCESTER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, lords, my choler being over-blown</div>
                     <div class="line">With walking once about the quadrangle,</div>
                     <div class="line">I come to talk of commonwealth affairs.</div>
                     <div class="line">As for your spiteful false objections,</div>
                     <div class="line">Prove them, and I lie open to the law:</div>
                     <div class="line">But God in mercy so deal with my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I in duty love my king and country!</div>
                     <div class="line">But, to the matter that we have in hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, my sovereign, York is meetest man</div>
                     <div class="line">To be your regent in the realm of France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Before we make election, give me leave</div>
                     <div class="line">To show some reason, of no little force,</div>
                     <div class="line">That York is most unmeet of any man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell thee, Suffolk, why I am unmeet:</div>
                     <div class="line">First, for I cannot flatter thee in pride;</div>
                     <div class="line">Next, if I be appointed for the place,</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of Somerset will keep me here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without discharge, money, or furniture,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till France be won into the Dauphin's hands:</div>
                     <div class="line">Last time, I danced attendance on his will</div>
                     <div class="line">Till Paris was besieged, famish'd, and lost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">That can I witness; and a fouler fact</div>
                     <div class="line">Did never traitor in the land commit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, headstrong Warwick!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Image of pride, why should I hold my peace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HORNER, the Armourer, and his man
PETER, guarded</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Because here is a man accused of treason:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray God the Duke of York excuse himself!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth any one accuse York for a traitor?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">What mean'st thou, Suffolk; tell me, what are these?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Please it your majesty, this is the man</div>
                     <div class="line">That doth accuse his master of high treason:</div>
                     <div class="line">His words were these: that Richard, Duke of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was rightful heir unto the English crown</div>
                     <div class="line">And that your majesty was a usurper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, man, were these thy words?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORNER</div>
                     <div class="line">An't shall please your majesty, I never said nor</div>
                     <div class="line">thought any such matter: God is my witness, I am</div>
                     <div class="line">falsely accused by the villain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">By these ten bones, my lords, he did speak them to</div>
                     <div class="line">me in the garret one night, as we were scouring my</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord of York's armour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Base dunghill villain and mechanical,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have thy head for this thy traitor's speech.</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech your royal majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him have all the rigor of the law.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORNER</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, my lord, hang me, if ever I spake the words.</div>
                     <div class="line">My accuser is my 'prentice; and when I did correct</div>
                     <div class="line">him for his fault the other day, he did vow upon his</div>
                     <div class="line">knees he would be even with me: I have good</div>
                     <div class="line">witness of this: therefore I beseech your majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">do not cast away an honest man for a villain's</div>
                     <div class="line">accusation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, what shall we say to this in law?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
