               <p>Noise within. Enter WARWICK, SALISBURY, and many Commons</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">It is reported, mighty sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">That good Duke Humphrey traitorously is murder'd</div>
                     <div class="line">By Suffolk and the Cardinal Beaufort's means.</div>
                     <div class="line">The commons, like an angry hive of bees</div>
                     <div class="line">That want their leader, scatter up and down</div>
                     <div class="line">And care not who they sting in his revenge.</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself have calm'd their spleenful mutiny,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until they hear the order of his death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is dead, good Warwick, 'tis too true;</div>
                     <div class="line">But how he died God knows, not Henry:</div>
                     <div class="line">Enter his chamber, view his breathless corpse,</div>
                     <div class="line">And comment then upon his sudden death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall I do, my liege. Stay, Salisbury,</div>
                     <div class="line">With the rude multitude till I return.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">O Thou that judgest all things, stay my thoughts,</div>
                     <div class="line">My thoughts, that labour to persuade my soul</div>
                     <div class="line">Some violent hands were laid on Humphrey's life!</div>
                     <div class="line">If my suspect be false, forgive me, God,</div>
                     <div class="line">For judgment only doth belong to thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fain would I go to chafe his paly lips</div>
                     <div class="line">With twenty thousand kisses, and to drain</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his face an ocean of salt tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell my love unto his dumb deaf trunk,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with my fingers feel his hand unfeeling:</div>
                     <div class="line">But all in vain are these mean obsequies;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to survey his dead and earthly image,</div>
                     <div class="line">What were it but to make my sorrow greater?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter WARWICK and others, bearing
GLOUCESTER'S body on a bed</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, gracious sovereign, view this body.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">That is to see how deep my grave is made;</div>
                     <div class="line">For with his soul fled all my worldly solace,</div>
                     <div class="line">For seeing him I see my life in death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">As surely as my soul intends to live</div>
                     <div class="line">With that dread King that took our state upon him</div>
                     <div class="line">To free us from his father's wrathful curse,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do believe that violent hands were laid</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the life of this thrice-famed duke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">A dreadful oath, sworn with a solemn tongue!</div>
                     <div class="line">What instance gives Lord Warwick for his vow?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">See how the blood is settled in his face.</div>
                     <div class="line">Oft have I seen a timely-parted ghost,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of ashy semblance, meagre, pale and bloodless,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being all descended to the labouring heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, in the conflict that it holds with death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Attracts the same for aidance 'gainst the enemy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which with the heart there cools and ne'er returneth</div>
                     <div class="line">To blush and beautify the cheek again.</div>
                     <div class="line">But see, his face is black and full of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">His eye-balls further out than when he lived,</div>
                     <div class="line">Staring full ghastly like a strangled man;</div>
                     <div class="line">His hair uprear'd, his nostrils stretched with struggling;</div>
                     <div class="line">His hands abroad display'd, as one that grasp'd</div>
                     <div class="line">And tugg'd for life and was by strength subdued:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, on the sheets his hair you see, is sticking;</div>
                     <div class="line">His well-proportion'd beard made rough and rugged,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to the summer's corn by tempest lodged.</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be but he was murder'd here;</div>
                     <div class="line">The least of all these signs were probable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Warwick, who should do the duke to death?</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself and Beaufort had him in protection;</div>
                     <div class="line">And we, I hope, sir, are no murderers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">But both of you were vow'd Duke Humphrey's foes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, forsooth, had the good duke to keep:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis like you would not feast him like a friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'tis well seen he found an enemy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you, belike, suspect these noblemen</div>
                     <div class="line">As guilty of Duke Humphrey's timeless death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Who finds the heifer dead and bleeding fresh</div>
                     <div class="line">And sees fast by a butcher with an axe,</div>
                     <div class="line">But will suspect 'twas he that made the slaughter?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who finds the partridge in the puttock's nest,</div>
                     <div class="line">But may imagine how the bird was dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although the kite soar with unbloodied beak?</div>
                     <div class="line">Even so suspicious is this tragedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you the butcher, Suffolk? Where's your knife?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is Beaufort term'd a kite? Where are his talons?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I wear no knife to slaughter sleeping men;</div>
                     <div class="line">But here's a vengeful sword, rusted with ease,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall be scoured in his rancorous heart</div>
                     <div class="line">That slanders me with murder's crimson badge.</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, if thou darest, proud Lord of Warwick-shire,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am faulty in Duke Humphrey's death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CARDINAL, SOMERSET, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">What dares not Warwick, if false Suffolk dare him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">He dares not calm his contumelious spirit</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor cease to be an arrogant controller,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though Suffolk dare him twenty thousand times.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, be still; with reverence may I say;</div>
                     <div class="line">For every word you speak in his behalf</div>
                     <div class="line">Is slander to your royal dignity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Blunt-witted lord, ignoble in demeanor!</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever lady wrong'd her lord so much,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mother took into her blameful bed</div>
                     <div class="line">Some stern untutor'd churl, and noble stock</div>
                     <div class="line">Was graft with crab-tree slip; whose fruit thou art,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never of the Nevils' noble race.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">But that the guilt of murder bucklers thee</div>
                     <div class="line">And I should rob the deathsman of his fee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Quitting thee thereby of ten thousand shames,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that my sovereign's presence makes me mild,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would, false murderous coward, on thy knee</div>
                     <div class="line">Make thee beg pardon for thy passed speech,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say it was thy mother that thou meant'st</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou thyself was born in bastardy;</div>
                     <div class="line">And after all this fearful homage done,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give thee thy hire and send thy soul to hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pernicious blood-sucker of sleeping men!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shall be waking well I shed thy blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">If from this presence thou darest go with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Away even now, or I will drag thee hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">Unworthy though thou art, I'll cope with thee</div>
                     <div class="line">And do some service to Duke Humphrey's ghost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt SUFFOLK and WARWICK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">What stronger breastplate than a heart untainted!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrice is he armed that hath his quarrel just,</div>
                     <div class="line">And he but naked, though lock'd up in steel</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose conscience with injustice is corrupted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A noise within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">What noise is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter SUFFOLK and WARWICK, with their
weapons drawn</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, lords! your wrathful weapons drawn</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in our presence! dare you be so bold?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what tumultuous clamour have we here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">The traitorous Warwick with the men of Bury</div>
                     <div class="line">Set all upon me, mighty sovereign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To the Commons, entering</span>  Sirs, stand apart;</div>
                     <div class="line">the king shall know your mind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dread lord, the commons send you word by me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless Lord Suffolk straight be done to death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or banished fair England's territories,</div>
                     <div class="line">They will by violence tear him from your palace</div>
                     <div class="line">And torture him with grievous lingering death.</div>
                     <div class="line">They say, by him the good Duke Humphrey died;</div>
                     <div class="line">They say, in him they fear your highness' death;</div>
                     <div class="line">And mere instinct of love and loyalty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Free from a stubborn opposite intent,</div>
                     <div class="line">As being thought to contradict your liking,</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes them thus forward in his banishment.</div>
                     <div class="line">They say, in care of your most royal person,</div>
                     <div class="line">That if your highness should intend to sleep</div>
                     <div class="line">And charge that no man should disturb your rest</div>
                     <div class="line">In pain of your dislike or pain of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, notwithstanding such a strait edict,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were there a serpent seen, with forked tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">That slily glided towards your majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">It were but necessary you were waked,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest, being suffer'd in that harmful slumber,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mortal worm might make the sleep eternal;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore do they cry, though you forbid,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they will guard you, whether you will or no,</div>
                     <div class="line">From such fell serpents as false Suffolk is,</div>
                     <div class="line">With whose envenomed and fatal sting,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your loving uncle, twenty times his worth,</div>
                     <div class="line">They say, is shamefully bereft of life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Commons</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  An answer from the king, my</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord of Salisbury!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis like the commons, rude unpolish'd hinds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could send such message to their sovereign:</div>
                     <div class="line">But you, my lord, were glad to be employ'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">To show how quaint an orator you are:</div>
                     <div class="line">But all the honour Salisbury hath won</div>
                     <div class="line">Is, that he was the lord ambassador</div>
                     <div class="line">Sent from a sort of tinkers to the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Commons</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  An answer from the king, or we will all break in!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, Salisbury, and tell them all from me.</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank them for their tender loving care;</div>
                     <div class="line">And had I not been cited so by them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet did I purpose as they do entreat;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, sure, my thoughts do hourly prophesy</div>
                     <div class="line">Mischance unto my state by Suffolk's means:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore, by His majesty I swear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose far unworthy deputy I am,</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall not breathe infection in this air</div>
                     <div class="line">But three days longer, on the pain of death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit SALISBURY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">O Henry, let me plead for gentle Suffolk!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Ungentle queen, to call him gentle Suffolk!</div>
                     <div class="line">No more, I say: if thou dost plead for him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wilt but add increase unto my wrath.</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I but said, I would have kept my word,</div>
                     <div class="line">But when I swear, it is irrevocable.</div>
                     <div class="line">If, after three days' space, thou here be'st found</div>
                     <div class="line">On any ground that I am ruler of,</div>
                     <div class="line">The world shall not be ransom for thy life.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Warwick, come, good Warwick, go with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have great matters to impart to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but QUEEN MARGARET and SUFFOLK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Mischance and sorrow go along with you!</div>
                     <div class="line">Heart's discontent and sour affliction</div>
                     <div class="line">Be playfellows to keep you company!</div>
                     <div class="line">There's two of you; the devil make a third!</div>
                     <div class="line">And threefold vengeance tend upon your steps!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Cease, gentle queen, these execrations,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let thy Suffolk take his heavy leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, coward woman and soft-hearted wretch!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou not spirit to curse thine enemy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague upon them! wherefore should I curse them?</div>
                     <div class="line">Would curses kill, as doth the mandrake's groan,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would invent as bitter-searching terms,</div>
                     <div class="line">As curst, as harsh and horrible to hear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver'd strongly through my fixed teeth,</div>
                     <div class="line">With full as many signs of deadly hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">As lean-faced Envy in her loathsome cave:</div>
                     <div class="line">My tongue should stumble in mine earnest words;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine eyes should sparkle like the beaten flint;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine hair be fixed on end, as one distract;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, every joint should seem to curse and ban:</div>
                     <div class="line">And even now my burthen'd heart would break,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should I not curse them. Poison be their drink!</div>
                     <div class="line">Gall, worse than gall, the daintiest that they taste!</div>
                     <div class="line">Their sweetest shade a grove of cypress trees!</div>
                     <div class="line">Their chiefest prospect murdering basilisks!</div>
                     <div class="line">Their softest touch as smart as lizards' sting!</div>
                     <div class="line">Their music frightful as the serpent's hiss,</div>
                     <div class="line">And boding screech-owls make the concert full!</div>
                     <div class="line">All the foul terrors in dark-seated hell--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough, sweet Suffolk; thou torment'st thyself;</div>
                     <div class="line">And these dread curses, like the sun 'gainst glass,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or like an overcharged gun, recoil,</div>
                     <div class="line">And turn the force of them upon thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">You bade me ban, and will you bid me leave?</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the ground that I am banish'd from,</div>
                     <div class="line">Well could I curse away a winter's night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though standing naked on a mountain top,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where biting cold would never let grass grow,</div>
                     <div class="line">And think it but a minute spent in sport.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me entreat thee cease. Give me thy hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may dew it with my mournful tears;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor let the rain of heaven wet this place,</div>
                     <div class="line">To wash away my woful monuments.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, could this kiss be printed in thy hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou mightst think upon these by the seal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through whom a thousand sighs are breathed for thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">So, get thee gone, that I may know my grief;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but surmised whiles thou art standing by,</div>
                     <div class="line">As one that surfeits thinking on a want.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will repeal thee, or, be well assured,</div>
                     <div class="line">Adventure to be banished myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">And banished I am, if but from thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go; speak not to me; even now be gone.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, go not yet! Even thus two friends condemn'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Embrace and kiss and take ten thousand leaves,</div>
                     <div class="line">Loather a hundred times to part than die.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet now farewell; and farewell life with thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus is poor Suffolk ten times banished;</div>
                     <div class="line">Once by the king, and three times thrice by thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not the land I care for, wert thou thence;</div>
                     <div class="line">A wilderness is populous enough,</div>
                     <div class="line">So Suffolk had thy heavenly company:</div>
                     <div class="line">For where thou art, there is the world itself,</div>
                     <div class="line">With every several pleasure in the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">And where thou art not, desolation.</div>
                     <div class="line">I can no more: live thou to joy thy life;</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself no joy in nought but that thou livest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter VAUX</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Wither goes Vaux so fast? what news, I prithee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VAUX</div>
                     <div class="line">To signify unto his majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">That Cardinal Beaufort is at point of death;</div>
                     <div class="line">For suddenly a grievous sickness took him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes him gasp and stare and catch the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">Blaspheming God and cursing men on earth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometimes he talks as if Duke Humphrey's ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Were by his side; sometime he calls the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And whispers to his pillow, as to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">The secrets of his overcharged soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am sent to tell his majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">That even now he cries aloud for him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Go tell this heavy message to the king.</div>
                     <p>Exit VAUX</p>
                     <div class="line">Ay me! what is this world! what news are these!</div>
                     <div class="line">But wherefore grieve I at an hour's poor loss,</div>
                     <div class="line">Omitting Suffolk's exile, my soul's treasure?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why only, Suffolk, mourn I not for thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with the southern clouds contend in tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Theirs for the earth's increase, mine for my sorrows?</div>
                     <div class="line">Now get thee hence: the king, thou know'st, is coming;</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou be found by me, thou art but dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">If I depart from thee, I cannot live;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in thy sight to die, what were it else</div>
                     <div class="line">But like a pleasant slumber in thy lap?</div>
                     <div class="line">Here could I breathe my soul into the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">As mild and gentle as the cradle-babe</div>
                     <div class="line">Dying with mother's dug between its lips:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, from thy sight, I should be raging mad,</div>
                     <div class="line">And cry out for thee to close up mine eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have thee with thy lips to stop my mouth;</div>
                     <div class="line">So shouldst thou either turn my flying soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I should breathe it so into thy body,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then it lived in sweet Elysium.</div>
                     <div class="line">To die by thee were but to die in jest;</div>
                     <div class="line">From thee to die were torture more than death:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me stay, befall what may befall!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! though parting be a fretful corrosive,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is applied to a deathful wound.</div>
                     <div class="line">To France, sweet Suffolk: let me hear from thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">For wheresoe'er thou art in this world's globe,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have an Iris that shall find thee out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">And take my heart with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">A jewel, lock'd into the wofull'st cask</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever did contain a thing of worth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Even as a splitted bark, so sunder we</div>
                     <div class="line">This way fall I to death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">This way for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A bedchamber.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the KING, SALISBURY, WARWICK, to the
CARDINAL in bed</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">How fares my lord? speak, Beaufort, to</div>
                     <div class="line">thy sovereign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou be'st death, I'll give thee England's treasure,</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough to purchase such another island,</div>
                     <div class="line">So thou wilt let me live, and feel no pain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, what a sign it is of evil life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where death's approach is seen so terrible!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Beaufort, it is thy sovereign speaks to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring me unto my trial when you will.</div>
                     <div class="line">Died he not in his bed? where should he die?</div>
                     <div class="line">Can I make men live, whether they will or no?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, torture me no more! I will confess.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alive again? then show me where he is:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give a thousand pound to look upon him.</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath no eyes, the dust hath blinded them.</div>
                     <div class="line">Comb down his hair; look, look! it stands upright,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like lime-twigs set to catch my winged soul.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me some drink; and bid the apothecary</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring the strong poison that I bought of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">O thou eternal Mover of the heavens.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look with a gentle eye upon this wretch!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, beat away the busy meddling fiend</div>
                     <div class="line">That lays strong siege unto this wretch's soul.</div>
                     <div class="line">And from his bosom purge this black despair!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">See, how the pangs of death do make him grin!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Disturb him not; let him pass peaceably.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace to his soul, if God's good pleasure be!</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord cardinal, if thou think'st on heaven's bliss,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold up thy hand, make signal of thy hope.</div>
                     <div class="line">He dies, and makes no sign. O God, forgive him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">So bad a death argues a monstrous life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Forbear to judge, for we are sinners all.</div>
                     <div class="line">Close up his eyes and draw the curtain close;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let us all to meditation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Blackheath.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Another part of Blackheath.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  London. The Tower.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  London. Cannon Street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  London. Smithfield.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.9">8. SCENE VIII.  Southwark.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.10">9. SCENE IX.  Kenilworth Castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.11">10. SCENE X.  Kent. IDEN's garden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Fight at sea. Ordnance goes off. Enter a
Captain, a Master, a Master's-mate, WALTER WHITMORE,
and others; with them SUFFOLK, and others, prisoners</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">The gaudy, blabbing and remorseful day</div>
                     <div class="line">Is crept into the bosom of the sea;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now loud-howling wolves arouse the jades</div>
                     <div class="line">That drag the tragic melancholy night;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, with their drowsy, slow and flagging wings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Clip dead men's graves and from their misty jaws</div>
                     <div class="line">Breathe foul contagious darkness in the air.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore bring forth the soldiers of our prize;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, whilst our pinnace anchors in the Downs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here shall they make their ransom on the sand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or with their blood stain this discolour'd shore.</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, this prisoner freely give I thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou that art his mate, make boot of this;</div>
                     <div class="line">The other, Walter Whitmore, is thy share.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">What is my ransom, master? let me know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Master</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand crowns, or else lay down your head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Master's-Mate</div>
                     <div class="line">And so much shall you give, or off goes yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">What, think you much to pay two thousand crowns,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bear the name and port of gentlemen?</div>
                     <div class="line">Cut both the villains' throats; for die you shall:</div>
                     <div class="line">The lives of those which we have lost in fight</div>
                     <div class="line">Be counterpoised with such a petty sum!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give it, sir; and therefore spare my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">And so will I and write home for it straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">I lost mine eye in laying the prize aboard,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore to revenge it, shalt thou die;</div>
                     <p>To SUFFOLK</p>
                     <div class="line">And so should these, if I might have my will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not so rash; take ransom, let him live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Look on my George; I am a gentleman:</div>
                     <div class="line">Rate me at what thou wilt, thou shalt be paid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I; my name is Walter Whitmore.</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! why start'st thou? what, doth</div>
                     <div class="line">death affright?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy name affrights me, in whose sound is death.</div>
                     <div class="line">A cunning man did calculate my birth</div>
                     <div class="line">And told me that by water I should die:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet let not this make thee be bloody-minded;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy name is Gaultier, being rightly sounded.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">Gaultier or Walter, which it is, I care not:</div>
                     <div class="line">Never yet did base dishonour blur our name,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with our sword we wiped away the blot;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, when merchant-like I sell revenge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Broke be my sword, my arms torn and defaced,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I proclaim'd a coward through the world!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, Whitmore; for thy prisoner is a prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Suffolk, William de la Pole.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Suffolk muffled up in rags!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but these rags are no part of the duke:</div>
                     <div class="line">Jove sometimes went disguised, and why not I?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">But Jove was never slain, as thou shalt be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Obscure and lowly swain, King Henry's blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">The honourable blood of Lancaster,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must not be shed by such a jaded groom.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou not kiss'd thy hand and held my stirrup?</div>
                     <div class="line">Bare-headed plodded by my foot-cloth mule</div>
                     <div class="line">And thought thee happy when I shook my head?</div>
                     <div class="line">How often hast thou waited at my cup,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fed from my trencher, kneel'd down at the board.</div>
                     <div class="line">When I have feasted with Queen Margaret?</div>
                     <div class="line">Remember it and let it make thee crest-fall'n,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and allay this thy abortive pride;</div>
                     <div class="line">How in our voiding lobby hast thou stood</div>
                     <div class="line">And duly waited for my coming forth?</div>
                     <div class="line">This hand of mine hath writ in thy behalf,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore shall it charm thy riotous tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, captain, shall I stab the forlorn swain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">First let my words stab him, as he hath me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Base slave, thy words are blunt and so art thou.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Convey him hence and on our longboat's side</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike off his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou darest not, for thy own.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, Pole.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Pole!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Pool! Sir Pool! lord!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, kennel, puddle, sink; whose filth and dirt</div>
                     <div class="line">Troubles the silver spring where England drinks.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will I dam up this thy yawning mouth</div>
                     <div class="line">For swallowing the treasure of the realm:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy lips that kiss'd the queen shall sweep the ground;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou that smiledst at good Duke Humphrey's death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the senseless winds shalt grin in vain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who in contempt shall hiss at thee again:</div>
                     <div class="line">And wedded be thou to the hags of hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">For daring to affy a mighty lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the daughter of a worthless king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Having neither subject, wealth, nor diadem.</div>
                     <div class="line">By devilish policy art thou grown great,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like ambitious Sylla, overgorged</div>
                     <div class="line">With gobbets of thy mother's bleeding heart.</div>
                     <div class="line">By thee Anjou and Maine were sold to France,</div>
                     <div class="line">The false revolting Normans thorough thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Disdain to call us lord, and Picardy</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath slain their governors, surprised our forts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sent the ragged soldiers wounded home.</div>
                     <div class="line">The princely Warwick, and the Nevils all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose dreadful swords were never drawn in vain,</div>
                     <div class="line">As hating thee, are rising up in arms:</div>
                     <div class="line">And now the house of York, thrust from the crown</div>
                     <div class="line">By shameful murder of a guiltless king</div>
                     <div class="line">And lofty proud encroaching tyranny,</div>
                     <div class="line">Burns with revenging fire; whose hopeful colours</div>
                     <div class="line">Advance our half-faced sun, striving to shine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the which is writ 'Invitis nubibus.'</div>
                     <div class="line">The commons here in Kent are up in arms:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to conclude, reproach and beggary</div>
                     <div class="line">Is crept into the palace of our king.</div>
                     <div class="line">And all by thee. Away! convey him hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">O that I were a god, to shoot forth thunder</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon these paltry, servile, abject drudges!</div>
                     <div class="line">Small things make base men proud: this villain here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being captain of a pinnace, threatens more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than Bargulus the strong Illyrian pirate.</div>
                     <div class="line">Drones suck not eagles' blood but rob beehives:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is impossible that I should die</div>
                     <div class="line">By such a lowly vassal as thyself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy words move rage and not remorse in me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I go of message from the queen to France;</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge thee waft me safely cross the Channel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Walter,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Suffolk, I must waft thee to thy death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Gelidus timor occupat artus it is thee I fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt have cause to fear before I leave thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, are ye daunted now? now will ye stoop?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious lord, entreat him, speak him fair.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Suffolk's imperial tongue is stern and rough,</div>
                     <div class="line">Used to command, untaught to plead for favour.</div>
                     <div class="line">Far be it we should honour such as these</div>
                     <div class="line">With humble suit: no, rather let my head</div>
                     <div class="line">Stoop to the block than these knees bow to any</div>
                     <div class="line">Save to the God of heaven and to my king;</div>
                     <div class="line">And sooner dance upon a bloody pole</div>
                     <div class="line">Than stand uncover'd to the vulgar groom.</div>
                     <div class="line">True nobility is exempt from fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">More can I bear than you dare execute.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Hale him away, and let him talk no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, soldiers, show what cruelty ye can,</div>
                     <div class="line">That this my death may never be forgot!</div>
                     <div class="line">Great men oft die by vile bezonians:</div>
                     <div class="line">A Roman sworder and banditto slave</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder'd sweet Tully; Brutus' bastard hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Stabb'd Julius Caesar; savage islanders</div>
                     <div class="line">Pompey the Great; and Suffolk dies by pirates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Whitmore and others with Suffolk</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">And as for these whose ransom we have set,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is our pleasure one of them depart;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore come you with us and let him go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but the First Gentleman</p>
               <p>Re-enter WHITMORE with SUFFOLK's body</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WHITMORE</div>
                     <div class="line">There let his head and lifeless body lie,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until the queen his mistress bury it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">O barbarous and bloody spectacle!</div>
                     <div class="line">His body will I bear unto the king:</div>
                     <div class="line">If he revenge it not, yet will his friends;</div>
                     <div class="line">So will the queen, that living held him dear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with the body</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Blackheath.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GEORGE BEVIS and JOHN HOLLAND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, and get thee a sword, though made of a lath;</div>
                     <div class="line">they have been up these two days.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">They have the more need to sleep now, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee, Jack Cade the clothier means to dress</div>
                     <div class="line">the commonwealth, and turn it, and set a new nap upon it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">So he had need, for 'tis threadbare. Well, I say it</div>
                     <div class="line">was never merry world in England since gentlemen came up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">O miserable age! virtue is not regarded in handicrafts-men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">The nobility think scorn to go in leather aprons.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, more, the king's council are no good workmen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">True; and yet it is said, labour in thy vocation;</div>
                     <div class="line">which is as much to say as, let the magistrates be</div>
                     <div class="line">labouring men; and therefore should we be</div>
                     <div class="line">magistrates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast hit it; for there's no better sign of a</div>
                     <div class="line">brave mind than a hard hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I see them! I see them! there's Best's son, the</div>
                     <div class="line">tanner of Wingham,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall have the skin of our enemies, to make</div>
                     <div class="line">dog's-leather of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">And Dick the Butcher,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Then is sin struck down like an ox, and iniquity's</div>
                     <div class="line">throat cut like a calf.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">And Smith the weaver,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Argo, their thread of life is spun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, let's fall in with them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drum. Enter CADE, DICK the Butcher, SMITH the
Weaver, and a Sawyer, with infinite numbers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">We John Cade, so termed of our supposed father,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Or rather, of stealing a cade of herrings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">For our enemies shall fall before us, inspired with</div>
                     <div class="line">the spirit of putting down kings and princes,</div>
                     <div class="line">--Command silence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Silence!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">My father was a Mortimer,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  He was an honest man, and a good</div>
                     <div class="line">bricklayer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">My mother a Plantagenet,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I knew her well; she was a midwife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">My wife descended of the Lacies,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  She was, indeed, a pedler's daughter, and</div>
                     <div class="line">sold many laces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  But now of late, notable to travel with her</div>
                     <div class="line">furred pack, she washes bucks here at home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore am I of an honourable house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Ay, by my faith, the field is honourable;</div>
                     <div class="line">and there was he borne, under a hedge, for his</div>
                     <div class="line">father had never a house but the cage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Valiant I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  A' must needs; for beggary is valiant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am able to endure much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  No question of that; for I have seen him</div>
                     <div class="line">whipped three market-days together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear neither sword nor fire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  He need not fear the sword; for his coat is of proof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  But methinks he should stand in fear of</div>
                     <div class="line">fire, being burnt i' the hand for stealing of sheep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Be brave, then; for your captain is brave, and vows</div>
                     <div class="line">reformation. There shall be in England seven</div>
                     <div class="line">halfpenny loaves sold for a penny: the three-hooped</div>
                     <div class="line">pot; shall have ten hoops and I will make it felony</div>
                     <div class="line">to drink small beer: all the realm shall be in</div>
                     <div class="line">common; and in Cheapside shall my palfrey go to</div>
                     <div class="line">grass: and when I am king, as king I will be,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">God save your majesty!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you, good people: there shall be no money;</div>
                     <div class="line">all shall eat and drink on my score; and I will</div>
                     <div class="line">apparel them all in one livery, that they may agree</div>
                     <div class="line">like brothers and worship me their lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">The first thing we do, let's kill all the lawyers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, that I mean to do. Is not this a lamentable</div>
                     <div class="line">thing, that of the skin of an innocent lamb should</div>
                     <div class="line">be made parchment? that parchment, being scribbled</div>
                     <div class="line">o'er, should undo a man? Some say the bee stings:</div>
                     <div class="line">but I say, 'tis the bee's wax; for I did but seal</div>
                     <div class="line">once to a thing, and I was never mine own man</div>
                     <div class="line">since. How now! who's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter some, bringing forward the Clerk of Chatham</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">The clerk of Chatham: he can write and read and</div>
                     <div class="line">cast accompt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
