                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">We took him setting of boys' copies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a villain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">Has a book in his pocket with red letters in't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then, he is a conjurer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, he can make obligations, and write court-hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry for't: the man is a proper man, of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">honour; unless I find him guilty, he shall not die.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, sirrah, I must examine thee: what is thy name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clerk</div>
                     <div class="line">Emmanuel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">They use to write it on the top of letters: 'twill</div>
                     <div class="line">go hard with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me alone. Dost thou use to write thy name? or</div>
                     <div class="line">hast thou a mark to thyself, like an honest</div>
                     <div class="line">plain-dealing man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLERK</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I thank God, I have been so well brought up</div>
                     <div class="line">that I can write my name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath confessed: away with him! he's a villain</div>
                     <div class="line">and a traitor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Away with him, I say! hang him with his pen and</div>
                     <div class="line">ink-horn about his neck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit one with the Clerk</p>
               <p>Enter MICHAEL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MICHAEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's our general?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here I am, thou particular fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MICHAEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Fly, fly, fly! Sir Humphrey Stafford and his</div>
                     <div class="line">brother are hard by, with the king's forces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand, villain, stand, or I'll fell thee down. He</div>
                     <div class="line">shall be encountered with a man as good as himself:</div>
                     <div class="line">he is but a knight, is a'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MICHAEL</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">To equal him, I will make myself a knight presently.</div>
                     <p>Kneels</p>
                     <div class="line">Rise up Sir John Mortimer.</div>
                     <p>Rises</p>
                     <div class="line">Now have at him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR HUMPHREY and WILLIAM STAFFORD, with
drum and soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUMPHREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Rebellious hinds, the filth and scum of Kent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark'd for the gallows, lay your weapons down;</div>
                     <div class="line">Home to your cottages, forsake this groom:</div>
                     <div class="line">The king is merciful, if you revolt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM STAFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">But angry, wrathful, and inclined to blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you go forward; therefore yield, or die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">As for these silken-coated slaves, I pass not:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is to you, good people, that I speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">Over whom, in time to come, I hope to reign;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am rightful heir unto the crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUMPHREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Villain, thy father was a plasterer;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou thyself a shearman, art thou not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">And Adam was a gardener.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM STAFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">And what of that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, this: Edmund Mortimer, Earl of March.</div>
                     <div class="line">Married the Duke of Clarence' daughter, did he not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUMPHREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">By her he had two children at one birth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM STAFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">That's false.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, there's the question; but I say, 'tis true:</div>
                     <div class="line">The elder of them, being put to nurse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was by a beggar-woman stolen away;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, ignorant of his birth and parentage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Became a bricklayer when he came to age:</div>
                     <div class="line">His son am I; deny it, if you can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, 'tis too true; therefore he shall be king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, he made a chimney in my father's house, and</div>
                     <div class="line">the bricks are alive at this day to testify it;</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore deny it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUMPHREY</div>
                     <div class="line">And will you credit this base drudge's words,</div>
                     <div class="line">That speaks he knows not what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, will we; therefore get ye gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM STAFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Jack Cade, the Duke of York hath taught you this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  He lies, for I invented it myself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to, sirrah, tell the king from me, that, for his</div>
                     <div class="line">father's sake, Henry the Fifth, in whose time boys</div>
                     <div class="line">went to span-counter for French crowns, I am content</div>
                     <div class="line">he shall reign; but I'll be protector over him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And furthermore, well have the Lord Say's head for</div>
                     <div class="line">selling the dukedom of Maine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">And good reason; for thereby is England mained, and</div>
                     <div class="line">fain to go with a staff, but that my puissance holds</div>
                     <div class="line">it up. Fellow kings, I tell you that that Lord Say</div>
                     <div class="line">hath gelded the commonwealth, and made it an eunuch:</div>
                     <div class="line">and more than that, he can speak French; and</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore he is a traitor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUMPHREY</div>
                     <div class="line">O gross and miserable ignorance!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, answer, if you can: the Frenchmen are our</div>
                     <div class="line">enemies; go to, then, I ask but this: can he that</div>
                     <div class="line">speaks with the tongue of an enemy be a good</div>
                     <div class="line">counsellor, or no?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no; and therefore we'll have his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM STAFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, seeing gentle words will not prevail,</div>
                     <div class="line">Assail them with the army of the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUMPHREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Herald, away; and throughout every town</div>
                     <div class="line">Proclaim them traitors that are up with Cade;</div>
                     <div class="line">That those which fly before the battle ends</div>
                     <div class="line">May, even in their wives' and children's sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be hang'd up for example at their doors:</div>
                     <div class="line">And you that be the king's friends, follow me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt WILLIAM STAFFORD and SIR HUMPHREY, and soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">And you that love the commons, follow me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now show yourselves men; 'tis for liberty.</div>
                     <div class="line">We will not leave one lord, one gentleman:</div>
                     <div class="line">Spare none but such as go in clouted shoon;</div>
                     <div class="line">For they are thrifty honest men, and such</div>
                     <div class="line">As would, but that they dare not, take our parts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">They are all in order and march toward us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">But then are we in order when we are most</div>
                     <div class="line">out of order. Come, march forward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Another part of Blackheath.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums to the fight, wherein SIR HUMPHREY and
WILLIAM STAFFORD are slain. Enter CADE and the rest</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's Dick, the butcher of Ashford?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">They fell before thee like sheep and oxen, and thou</div>
                     <div class="line">behavedst thyself as if thou hadst been in thine own</div>
                     <div class="line">slaughter-house: therefore thus will I reward thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">the Lent shall be as long again as it is; and thou</div>
                     <div class="line">shalt have a licence to kill for a hundred lacking</div>
                     <div class="line">one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I desire no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to speak truth, thou deservest no less. This</div>
                     <div class="line">monument of the victory will I bear;</div>
                     <p>Putting on SIR HUMPHREY'S brigandine</p>
                     <div class="line">and the bodies shall be dragged at my horse' heels</div>
                     <div class="line">till I do come to London, where we will have the</div>
                     <div class="line">mayor's sword borne before us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">If we mean to thrive and do good, break open the</div>
                     <div class="line">gaols and let out the prisoners.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not that, I warrant thee. Come, let's march</div>
                     <div class="line">towards London.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY VI with a supplication, and the
QUEEN with SUFFOLK'S head, BUCKINGHAM and Lord SAY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Oft have I heard that grief softens the mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">And makes it fearful and degenerate;</div>
                     <div class="line">Think therefore on revenge and cease to weep.</div>
                     <div class="line">But who can cease to weep and look on this?</div>
                     <div class="line">Here may his head lie on my throbbing breast:</div>
                     <div class="line">But where's the body that I should embrace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What answer makes your grace to the rebels'</div>
                     <div class="line">supplication?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll send some holy bishop to entreat;</div>
                     <div class="line">For God forbid so many simple souls</div>
                     <div class="line">Should perish by the sword! And I myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than bloody war shall cut them short,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will parley with Jack Cade their general:</div>
                     <div class="line">But stay, I'll read it over once again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, barbarous villains! hath this lovely face</div>
                     <div class="line">Ruled, like a wandering planet, over me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And could it not enforce them to relent,</div>
                     <div class="line">That were unworthy to behold the same?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Say, Jack Cade hath sworn to have thy head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but I hope your highness shall have his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, madam!</div>
                     <div class="line">Still lamenting and mourning for Suffolk's death?</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear me, love, if that I had been dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wouldst not have mourn'd so much for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my love, I should not mourn, but die for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! what news? why comest thou in such haste?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">The rebels are in Southwark; fly, my lord!</div>
                     <div class="line">Jack Cade proclaims himself Lord Mortimer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Descended from the Duke of Clarence' house,</div>
                     <div class="line">And calls your grace usurper openly</div>
                     <div class="line">And vows to crown himself in Westminster.</div>
                     <div class="line">His army is a ragged multitude</div>
                     <div class="line">Of hinds and peasants, rude and merciless:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Humphrey Stafford and his brother's death</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath given them heart and courage to proceed:</div>
                     <div class="line">All scholars, lawyers, courtiers, gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">They call false caterpillars, and intend their death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">O graceless men! they know not what they do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious lord, return to Killingworth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until a power be raised to put them down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, were the Duke of Suffolk now alive,</div>
                     <div class="line">These Kentish rebels would be soon appeased!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Say, the traitors hate thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore away with us to Killingworth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">So might your grace's person be in danger.</div>
                     <div class="line">The sight of me is odious in their eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore in this city will I stay</div>
                     <div class="line">And live alone as secret as I may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter another Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Jack Cade hath gotten London bridge:</div>
                     <div class="line">The citizens fly and forsake their houses:</div>
                     <div class="line">The rascal people, thirsting after prey,</div>
                     <div class="line">Join with the traitor, and they jointly swear</div>
                     <div class="line">To spoil the city and your royal court.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Then linger not, my lord, away, take horse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Margaret; God, our hope, will succor us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">My hope is gone, now Suffolk is deceased.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, my lord: trust not the Kentish rebels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Trust nobody, for fear you be betray'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">The trust I have is in mine innocence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore am I bold and resolute.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  London. The Tower.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SCALES upon the Tower, walking.
Then enter two or three Citizens below</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SCALES</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! is Jack Cade slain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my lord, nor likely to be slain; for they have</div>
                     <div class="line">won the bridge, killing all those that withstand</div>
                     <div class="line">them: the lord mayor craves aid of your honour from</div>
                     <div class="line">the Tower, to defend the city from the rebels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SCALES</div>
                     <div class="line">Such aid as I can spare you shall command;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I am troubled here with them myself;</div>
                     <div class="line">The rebels have assay'd to win the Tower.</div>
                     <div class="line">But get you to Smithfield, and gather head,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thither I will send you Matthew Goffe;</div>
                     <div class="line">Fight for your king, your country and your lives;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, farewell, for I must hence again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  London. Cannon Street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CADE and the rest, and strikes his staff on
London-stone</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Now is Mortimer lord of this city. And here, sitting</div>
                     <div class="line">upon London-stone, I charge and command that, of the</div>
                     <div class="line">city's cost, the pissing-conduit run nothing but</div>
                     <div class="line">claret wine this first year of our reign. And now</div>
                     <div class="line">henceforward it shall be treason for any that calls</div>
                     <div class="line">me other than Lord Mortimer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Soldier, running</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Jack Cade! Jack Cade!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Knock him down there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They kill him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">If this fellow be wise, he'll never call ye Jack</div>
                     <div class="line">Cade more: I think he hath a very fair warning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, there's an army gathered together in</div>
                     <div class="line">Smithfield.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, then, let's go fight with them; but first, go</div>
                     <div class="line">and set London bridge on fire; and, if you can, burn</div>
                     <div class="line">down the Tower too. Come, let's away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  London. Smithfield.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums. MATTHEW GOFFE is slain, and all the rest.
Then enter CADE, with his company.</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">So, sirs: now go some and pull down the Savoy;</div>
                     <div class="line">others to the inns of court; down with them all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a suit unto your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it a lordship, thou shalt have it for that word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Only that the laws of England may come out of your mouth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Mass, 'twill be sore law, then; for he was</div>
                     <div class="line">thrust in the mouth with a spear, and 'tis not whole</div>
                     <div class="line">yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SMITH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Nay, John, it will be stinking law for his</div>
                     <div class="line">breath stinks with eating toasted cheese.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">I have thought upon it, it shall be so. Away, burn</div>
                     <div class="line">all the records of the realm: my mouth shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">the parliament of England.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Then we are like to have biting statutes,</div>
                     <div class="line">unless his teeth be pulled out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">And henceforward all things shall be in common.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, a prize, a prize! here's the Lord Say,</div>
                     <div class="line">which sold the towns in France; he that made us pay</div>
                     <div class="line">one and twenty fifteens, and one shilling to the</div>
                     <div class="line">pound, the last subsidy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BEVIS, with Lord SAY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, he shall be beheaded for it ten times. Ah,</div>
                     <div class="line">thou say, thou serge, nay, thou buckram lord! now</div>
                     <div class="line">art thou within point-blank of our jurisdiction</div>
                     <div class="line">regal. What canst thou answer to my majesty for</div>
                     <div class="line">giving up of Normandy unto Mounsieur Basimecu, the</div>
                     <div class="line">dauphin of France? Be it known unto thee by these</div>
                     <div class="line">presence, even the presence of Lord Mortimer, that I</div>
                     <div class="line">am the besom that must sweep the court clean of such</div>
                     <div class="line">filth as thou art. Thou hast most traitorously</div>
                     <div class="line">corrupted the youth of the realm in erecting a</div>
                     <div class="line">grammar school; and whereas, before, our forefathers</div>
                     <div class="line">had no other books but the score and the tally, thou</div>
                     <div class="line">hast caused printing to be used, and, contrary to</div>
                     <div class="line">the king, his crown and dignity, thou hast built a</div>
                     <div class="line">paper-mill. It will be proved to thy face that thou</div>
                     <div class="line">hast men about thee that usually talk of a noun and</div>
                     <div class="line">a verb, and such abominable words as no Christian</div>
                     <div class="line">ear can endure to hear. Thou hast appointed</div>
                     <div class="line">justices of peace, to call poor men before them</div>
                     <div class="line">about matters they were not able to answer.</div>
                     <div class="line">Moreover, thou hast put them in prison; and because</div>
                     <div class="line">they could not read, thou hast hanged them; when,</div>
                     <div class="line">indeed, only for that cause they have been most</div>
                     <div class="line">worthy to live. Thou dost ride in a foot-cloth, dost thou not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">What of that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, thou oughtest not to let thy horse wear a</div>
                     <div class="line">cloak, when honester men than thou go in their hose</div>
                     <div class="line">and doublets.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And work in their shirt too; as myself, for example,</div>
                     <div class="line">that am a butcher.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">You men of Kent,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">What say you of Kent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but this; 'tis 'bona terra, mala gens.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Away with him, away with him! he speaks Latin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me but speak, and bear me where you will.</div>
                     <div class="line">Kent, in the Commentaries Caesar writ,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is term'd the civil'st place of this isle:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet is the country, because full of riches;</div>
                     <div class="line">The people liberal, valiant, active, wealthy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which makes me hope you are not void of pity.</div>
                     <div class="line">I sold not Maine, I lost not Normandy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, to recover them, would lose my life.</div>
                     <div class="line">Justice with favour have I always done;</div>
                     <div class="line">Prayers and tears have moved me, gifts could never.</div>
                     <div class="line">When have I aught exacted at your hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">But to maintain the king, the realm and you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Large gifts have I bestow'd on learned clerks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because my book preferr'd me to the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And seeing ignorance is the curse of God,</div>
                     <div class="line">Knowledge the wing wherewith we fly to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless you be possess'd with devilish spirits,</div>
                     <div class="line">You cannot but forbear to murder me:</div>
                     <div class="line">This tongue hath parley'd unto foreign kings</div>
                     <div class="line">For your behoof,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, when struck'st thou one blow in the field?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Great men have reaching hands: oft have I struck</div>
                     <div class="line">Those that I never saw and struck them dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEVIS</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous coward! what, to come behind folks?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">These cheeks are pale for watching for your good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Give him a box o' the ear and that will make 'em red again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Long sitting to determine poor men's causes</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath made me full of sickness and diseases.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye shall have a hempen caudle, then, and the help of hatchet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost thou quiver, man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">The palsy, and not fear, provokes me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, he nods at us, as who should say, I'll be even</div>
                     <div class="line">with you: I'll see if his head will stand steadier</div>
                     <div class="line">on a pole, or no. Take him away, and behead him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me wherein have I offended most?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I affected wealth or honour? speak.</div>
                     <div class="line">Are my chests fill'd up with extorted gold?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is my apparel sumptuous to behold?</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom have I injured, that ye seek my death?</div>
                     <div class="line">These hands are free from guiltless bloodshedding,</div>
                     <div class="line">This breast from harbouring foul deceitful thoughts.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me live!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I feel remorse in myself with his words;</div>
                     <div class="line">but I'll bridle it: he shall die, an it be but for</div>
                     <div class="line">pleading so well for his life. Away with him! he</div>
                     <div class="line">has a familiar under his tongue; he speaks not o'</div>
                     <div class="line">God's name. Go, take him away, I say, and strike</div>
                     <div class="line">off his head presently; and then break into his</div>
                     <div class="line">son-in-law's house, Sir James Cromer, and strike off</div>
                     <div class="line">his head, and bring them both upon two poles hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall be done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, countrymen! if when you make your prayers,</div>
                     <div class="line">God should be so obdurate as yourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">How would it fare with your departed souls?</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore yet relent, and save my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Away with him! and do as I command ye.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt some with Lord SAY</p>
                     <div class="line">The proudest peer in the realm shall not wear a head</div>
                     <div class="line">on his shoulders, unless he pay me tribute; there</div>
                     <div class="line">shall not a maid be married, but she shall pay to me</div>
                     <div class="line">her maidenhead ere they have it: men shall hold of</div>
                     <div class="line">me in capite; and we charge and command that their</div>
                     <div class="line">wives be as free as heart can wish or tongue can tell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DICK</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, when shall we go to Cheapside and take up</div>
                     <div class="line">commodities upon our bills?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">O, brave!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter one with the heads</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">But is not this braver? Let them kiss one another,</div>
                     <div class="line">for they loved well when they were alive. Now part</div>
                     <div class="line">them again, lest they consult about the giving up of</div>
                     <div class="line">some more towns in France. Soldiers, defer the</div>
                     <div class="line">spoil of the city until night: for with these borne</div>
                     <div class="line">before us, instead of maces, will we ride through</div>
                     <div class="line">the streets, and at every corner have them kiss. Away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.9">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>8. SCENE VIII.  Southwark.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum and retreat. Enter CADE and all his
rabblement</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Up Fish Street! down Saint Magnus' Corner! Kill</div>
                     <div class="line">and knock down! throw them into Thames!</div>
                     <p>Sound a parley</p>
                     <div class="line">What noise is this I hear? Dare any be so bold to</div>
                     <div class="line">sound retreat or parley, when I command them kill?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM and CLIFFORD, attended</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, here they be that dare and will disturb thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Know, Cade, we come ambassadors from the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the commons whom thou hast misled;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here pronounce free pardon to them all</div>
                     <div class="line">That will forsake thee and go home in peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">What say ye, countrymen? will ye relent,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yield to mercy whilst 'tis offer'd you;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or let a rebel lead you to your deaths?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who loves the king and will embrace his pardon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fling up his cap, and say 'God save his majesty!'</div>
                     <div class="line">Who hateth him and honours not his father,</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry the Fifth, that made all France to quake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shake he his weapon at us and pass by.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">God save the king! God save the king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">What, Buckingham and Clifford, are ye so brave? And</div>
                     <div class="line">you, base peasants, do ye believe him? will you</div>
                     <div class="line">needs be hanged with your pardons about your necks?</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath my sword therefore broke through London gates,</div>
                     <div class="line">that you should leave me at the White Hart in</div>
                     <div class="line">Southwark? I thought ye would never have given out</div>
                     <div class="line">these arms till you had recovered your ancient</div>
                     <div class="line">freedom: but you are all recreants and dastards,</div>
                     <div class="line">and delight to live in slavery to the nobility. Let</div>
                     <div class="line">them break your backs with burthens, take your</div>
                     <div class="line">houses over your heads, ravish your wives and</div>
                     <div class="line">daughters before your faces: for me, I will make</div>
                     <div class="line">shift for one; and so, God's curse light upon you</div>
                     <div class="line">all!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll follow Cade, we'll follow Cade!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Is Cade the son of Henry the Fifth,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus you do exclaim you'll go with him?</div>
                     <div class="line">Will he conduct you through the heart of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make the meanest of you earls and dukes?</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, he hath no home, no place to fly to;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor knows he how to live but by the spoil,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless by robbing of your friends and us.</div>
                     <div class="line">Were't not a shame, that whilst you live at jar,</div>
                     <div class="line">The fearful French, whom you late vanquished,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should make a start o'er seas and vanquish you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks already in this civil broil</div>
                     <div class="line">I see them lording it in London streets,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crying 'Villiago!' unto all they meet.</div>
                     <div class="line">Better ten thousand base-born Cades miscarry</div>
                     <div class="line">Than you should stoop unto a Frenchman's mercy.</div>
                     <div class="line">To France, to France, and get what you have lost;</div>
                     <div class="line">Spare England, for it is your native coast;</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry hath money, you are strong and manly;</div>
                     <div class="line">God on our side, doubt not of victory.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">A Clifford! a Clifford! we'll follow the king and Clifford.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever feather so lightly blown to and fro as this</div>
                     <div class="line">multitude? The name of Henry the Fifth hales them</div>
                     <div class="line">to an hundred mischiefs, and makes them leave me</div>
                     <div class="line">desolate. I see them lay their heads together to</div>
                     <div class="line">surprise me. My sword make way for me, for here is</div>
                     <div class="line">no staying. In despite of the devils and hell, have</div>
                     <div class="line">through the very middest of you? and heavens and</div>
                     <div class="line">honour be witness, that no want of resolution in me.</div>
                     <div class="line">but only my followers' base and ignominious</div>
                     <div class="line">treasons, makes me betake me to my heels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What, is he fled? Go some, and follow him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he that brings his head unto the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall have a thousand crowns for his reward.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt some of them</p>
                     <div class="line">Follow me, soldiers: we'll devise a mean</div>
                     <div class="line">To reconcile you all unto the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.10">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>9. SCENE IX.  Kenilworth Castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Sound Trumpets. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN
MARGARET, and SOMERSET, on the terrace</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever king that joy'd an earthly throne,</div>
                     <div class="line">And could command no more content than I?</div>
                     <div class="line">No sooner was I crept out of my cradle</div>
                     <div class="line">But I was made a king, at nine months old.</div>
                     <div class="line">Was never subject long'd to be a king</div>
                     <div class="line">As I do long and wish to be a subject.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM and CLIFFORD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Health and glad tidings to your majesty!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Buckingham, is the traitor Cade surprised?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or is he but retired to make him strong?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter below, multitudes, with halters about
their necks</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">He is fled, my lord, and all his powers do yield;</div>
                     <div class="line">And humbly thus, with halters on their necks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Expect your highness' doom of life or death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, heaven, set ope thy everlasting gates,</div>
                     <div class="line">To entertain my vows of thanks and praise!</div>
                     <div class="line">Soldiers, this day have you redeemed your lives,</div>
                     <div class="line">And show'd how well you love your prince and country:</div>
                     <div class="line">Continue still in this so good a mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Henry, though he be infortunate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Assure yourselves, will never be unkind:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, with thanks and pardon to you all,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do dismiss you to your several countries.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">God save the king! God save the king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Please it your grace to be advertised</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of York is newly come from Ireland,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a puissant and a mighty power</div>
                     <div class="line">Of gallowglasses and stout kerns</div>
                     <div class="line">Is marching hitherward in proud array,</div>
                     <div class="line">And still proclaimeth, as he comes along,</div>
                     <div class="line">His arms are only to remove from thee</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Somerset, whom he terms traitor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus stands my state, 'twixt Cade and York distress'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a ship that, having 'scaped a tempest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is straightway calm'd and boarded with a pirate:</div>
                     <div class="line">But now is Cade driven back, his men dispersed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now is York in arms to second him.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, Buckingham, go and meet him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ask him what's the reason of these arms.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him I'll send Duke Edmund to the Tower;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, Somerset, we'll commit thee thither,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until his army be dismiss'd from him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll yield myself to prison willingly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or unto death, to do my country good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">In any case, be not too rough in terms;</div>
                     <div class="line">For he is fierce and cannot brook hard language.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, my lord; and doubt not so to deal</div>
                     <div class="line">As all things shall redound unto your good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, wife, let's in, and learn to govern better;</div>
                     <div class="line">For yet may England curse my wretched reign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.11">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>10. SCENE X.  Kent. IDEN's garden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CADE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie on ambition! fie on myself, that have a sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">and yet am ready to famish! These five days have I</div>
                     <div class="line">hid me in these woods and durst not peep out, for</div>
                     <div class="line">all the country is laid for me; but now am I so</div>
                     <div class="line">hungry that if I might have a lease of my life for a</div>
                     <div class="line">thousand years I could stay no longer. Wherefore,</div>
                     <div class="line">on a brick wall have I climbed into this garden, to</div>
                     <div class="line">see if I can eat grass, or pick a sallet another</div>
                     <div class="line">while, which is not amiss to cool a man's stomach</div>
                     <div class="line">this hot weather. And I think this word 'sallet'</div>
                     <div class="line">was born to do me good: for many a time, but for a</div>
                     <div class="line">sallet, my brainpan had been cleft with a brown</div>
                     <div class="line">bill; and many a time, when I have been dry and</div>
                     <div class="line">bravely marching, it hath served me instead of a</div>
                     <div class="line">quart pot to drink in; and now the word 'sallet'</div>
                     <div class="line">must serve me to feed on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter IDEN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, who would live turmoiled in the court,</div>
                     <div class="line">And may enjoy such quiet walks as these?</div>
                     <div class="line">This small inheritance my father left me</div>
                     <div class="line">Contenteth me, and worth a monarchy.</div>
                     <div class="line">I seek not to wax great by others' waning,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or gather wealth, I care not, with what envy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sufficeth that I have maintains my state</div>
                     <div class="line">And sends the poor well pleased from my gate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's the lord of the soil come to seize me for a</div>
                     <div class="line">stray, for entering his fee-simple without leave.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, villain, thou wilt betray me, and get a thousand</div>
                     <div class="line">crowns of the king carrying my head to him: but</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make thee eat iron like an ostrich, and swallow</div>
                     <div class="line">my sword like a great pin, ere thou and I part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, rude companion, whatsoe'er thou be,</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thee not; why, then, should I betray thee?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't not enough to break into my garden,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a thief, to come to rob my grounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Climbing my walls in spite of me the owner,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou wilt brave me with these saucy terms?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Brave thee! ay, by the best blood that ever was</div>
                     <div class="line">broached, and beard thee too. Look on me well: I</div>
                     <div class="line">have eat no meat these five days; yet, come thou and</div>
                     <div class="line">thy five men, and if I do not leave you all as dead</div>
                     <div class="line">as a doornail, I pray God I may never eat grass more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, it shall ne'er be said, while England stands,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Alexander Iden, an esquire of Kent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Took odds to combat a poor famish'd man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Oppose thy steadfast-gazing eyes to mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">See if thou canst outface me with thy looks:</div>
                     <div class="line">Set limb to limb, and thou art far the lesser;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy hand is but a finger to my fist,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy leg a stick compared with this truncheon;</div>
                     <div class="line">My foot shall fight with all the strength thou hast;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if mine arm be heaved in the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy grave is digg'd already in the earth.</div>
                     <div class="line">As for words, whose greatness answers words,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let this my sword report what speech forbears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">By my valour, the most complete champion that ever I</div>
                     <div class="line">heard! Steel, if thou turn the edge, or cut not out</div>
                     <div class="line">the burly-boned clown in chines of beef ere thou</div>
                     <div class="line">sleep in thy sheath, I beseech God on my knees thou</div>
                     <div class="line">mayst be turned to hobnails.</div>
                     <p>Here they fight. CADE falls</p>
                     <div class="line">O, I am slain! famine and no other hath slain me:</div>
                     <div class="line">let ten thousand devils come against me, and give me</div>
                     <div class="line">but the ten meals I have lost, and I'll defy them</div>
                     <div class="line">all. Wither, garden; and be henceforth a</div>
                     <div class="line">burying-place to all that do dwell in this house,</div>
                     <div class="line">because the unconquered soul of Cade is fled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't Cade that I have slain, that monstrous traitor?</div>
                     <div class="line">Sword, I will hollow thee for this thy deed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang thee o'er my tomb when I am dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er shall this blood be wiped from thy point;</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou shalt wear it as a herald's coat,</div>
                     <div class="line">To emblaze the honour that thy master got.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Iden, farewell, and be proud of thy victory. Tell</div>
                     <div class="line">Kent from me, she hath lost her best man, and exhort</div>
                     <div class="line">all the world to be cowards; for I, that never</div>
                     <div class="line">feared any, am vanquished by famine, not by valour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">How much thou wrong'st me, heaven be my judge.</div>
                     <div class="line">Die, damned wretch, the curse of her that bare thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">And as I thrust thy body in with my sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">So wish I, I might thrust thy soul to hell.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence will I drag thee headlong by the heels</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto a dunghill which shall be thy grave,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there cut off thy most ungracious head;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I will bear in triumph to the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Leaving thy trunk for crows to feed upon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Saint Alban's.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.</a>
                        </span>
