                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter YORK, and his army of Irish, with drum
and colours</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">From Ireland thus comes York to claim his right,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pluck the crown from feeble Henry's head:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ring, bells, aloud; burn, bonfires, clear and bright,</div>
                     <div class="line">To entertain great England's lawful king.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah! sancta majestas, who would not buy thee dear?</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them obey that know not how to rule;</div>
                     <div class="line">This hand was made to handle naught but gold.</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot give due action to my words,</div>
                     <div class="line">Except a sword or sceptre balance it:</div>
                     <div class="line">A sceptre shall it have, have I a soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">On which I'll toss the flower-de-luce of France.</div>
                     <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM</p>
                     <div class="line">Whom have we here? Buckingham, to disturb me?</div>
                     <div class="line">The king hath sent him, sure: I must dissemble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">York, if thou meanest well, I greet thee well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Humphrey of Buckingham, I accept thy greeting.</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou a messenger, or come of pleasure?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">A messenger from Henry, our dread liege,</div>
                     <div class="line">To know the reason of these arms in peace;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or why thou, being a subject as I am,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against thy oath and true allegiance sworn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should raise so great a power without his leave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or dare to bring thy force so near the court.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Scarce can I speak, my choler is so great:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I could hew up rocks and fight with flint,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am so angry at these abject terms;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now, like Ajax Telamonius,</div>
                     <div class="line">On sheep or oxen could I spend my fury.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am far better born than is the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">More like a king, more kingly in my thoughts:</div>
                     <div class="line">But I must make fair weather yet a while,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till Henry be more weak and I more strong,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Buckingham, I prithee, pardon me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have given no answer all this while;</div>
                     <div class="line">My mind was troubled with deep melancholy.</div>
                     <div class="line">The cause why I have brought this army hither</div>
                     <div class="line">Is to remove proud Somerset from the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seditious to his grace and to the state.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">That is too much presumption on thy part:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if thy arms be to no other end,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king hath yielded unto thy demand:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Somerset is in the Tower.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thine honour, is he prisoner?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon mine honour, he is prisoner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, Buckingham, I do dismiss my powers.</div>
                     <div class="line">Soldiers, I thank you all; disperse yourselves;</div>
                     <div class="line">Meet me to-morrow in St. George's field,</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall have pay and every thing you wish.</div>
                     <div class="line">And let my sovereign, virtuous Henry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Command my eldest son, nay, all my sons,</div>
                     <div class="line">As pledges of my fealty and love;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll send them all as willing as I live:</div>
                     <div class="line">Lands, goods, horse, armour, any thing I have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is his to use, so Somerset may die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">York, I commend this kind submission:</div>
                     <div class="line">We twain will go into his highness' tent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY VI and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Buckingham, doth York intend no harm to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus he marcheth with thee arm in arm?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">In all submission and humility</div>
                     <div class="line">York doth present himself unto your highness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Then what intends these forces thou dost bring?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">To heave the traitor Somerset from hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fight against that monstrous rebel Cade,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who since I heard to be discomfited.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter IDEN, with CADE'S head</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">If one so rude and of so mean condition</div>
                     <div class="line">May pass into the presence of a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, I present your grace a traitor's head,</div>
                     <div class="line">The head of Cade, whom I in combat slew.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">The head of Cade! Great God, how just art Thou!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me view his visage, being dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">That living wrought me such exceeding trouble.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, my friend, art thou the man that slew him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">I was, an't like your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">How art thou call'd? and what is thy degree?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">Alexander Iden, that's my name;</div>
                     <div class="line">A poor esquire of Kent, that loves his king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">So please it you, my lord, 'twere not amiss</div>
                     <div class="line">He were created knight for his good service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Iden, kneel down.</div>
                     <p>He kneels</p>
                     <div class="line">Rise up a knight.</div>
                     <div class="line">We give thee for reward a thousand marks,</div>
                     <div class="line">And will that thou henceforth attend on us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                     <div class="line">May Iden live to merit such a bounty.</div>
                     <div class="line">And never live but true unto his liege!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Rises</p>
               <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET and SOMERSET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">See, Buckingham, Somerset comes with the queen:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, bid her hide him quickly from the duke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">For thousand Yorks he shall not hide his head,</div>
                     <div class="line">But boldly stand and front him to his face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! is Somerset at liberty?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, York, unloose thy long-imprison'd thoughts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let thy tongue be equal with thy heart.</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I endure the sight of Somerset?</div>
                     <div class="line">False king! why hast thou broken faith with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Knowing how hardly I can brook abuse?</div>
                     <div class="line">King did I call thee? no, thou art not king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not fit to govern and rule multitudes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which darest not, no, nor canst not rule a traitor.</div>
                     <div class="line">That head of thine doth not become a crown;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy hand is made to grasp a palmer's staff,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not to grace an awful princely sceptre.</div>
                     <div class="line">That gold must round engirt these brows of mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose smile and frown, like to Achilles' spear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is able with the change to kill and cure.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is a hand to hold a sceptre up</div>
                     <div class="line">And with the same to act controlling laws.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give place: by heaven, thou shalt rule no more</div>
                     <div class="line">O'er him whom heaven created for thy ruler.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous traitor! I arrest thee, York,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of capital treason 'gainst the king and crown;</div>
                     <div class="line">Obey, audacious traitor; kneel for grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Wouldst have me kneel? first let me ask of these,</div>
                     <div class="line">If they can brook I bow a knee to man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, call in my sons to be my bail;</div>
                     <p>Exit Attendant</p>
                     <div class="line">I know, ere they will have me go to ward,</div>
                     <div class="line">They'll pawn their swords for my enfranchisement.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Call hither Clifford! bid him come amain,</div>
                     <div class="line">To say if that the bastard boys of York</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be the surety for their traitor father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit BUCKINGHAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">O blood-besotted Neapolitan,</div>
                     <div class="line">Outcast of Naples, England's bloody scourge!</div>
                     <div class="line">The sons of York, thy betters in their birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be their father's bail; and bane to those</div>
                     <div class="line">That for my surety will refuse the boys!</div>
                     <p>Enter EDWARD and RICHARD</p>
                     <div class="line">See where they come: I'll warrant they'll</div>
                     <div class="line">make it good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CLIFFORD and YOUNG CLIFFORD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">And here comes Clifford to deny their bail.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Health and all happiness to my lord the king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Kneels</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee, Clifford: say, what news with thee?</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, do not fright us with an angry look;</div>
                     <div class="line">We are thy sovereign, Clifford, kneel again;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thy mistaking so, we pardon thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">This is my king, York, I do not mistake;</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou mistakest me much to think I do:</div>
                     <div class="line">To Bedlam with him! is the man grown mad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Clifford; a bedlam and ambitious humour</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes him oppose himself against his king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">He is a traitor; let him to the Tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">And chop away that factious pate of his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">He is arrested, but will not obey;</div>
                     <div class="line">His sons, he says, shall give their words for him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you not, sons?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, noble father, if our words will serve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">And if words will not, then our weapons shall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a brood of traitors have we here!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Look in a glass, and call thy image so:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thy king, and thou a false-heart traitor.</div>
                     <div class="line">Call hither to the stake my two brave bears,</div>
                     <div class="line">That with the very shaking of their chains</div>
                     <div class="line">They may astonish these fell-lurking curs:</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid Salisbury and Warwick come to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the WARWICK and SALISBURY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Are these thy bears? we'll bait thy bears to death.</div>
                     <div class="line">And manacle the bear-ward in their chains,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou darest bring them to the baiting place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Oft have I seen a hot o'erweening cur</div>
                     <div class="line">Run back and bite, because he was withheld;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, being suffer'd with the bear's fell paw,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath clapp'd his tail between his legs and cried:</div>
                     <div class="line">And such a piece of service will you do,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you oppose yourselves to match Lord Warwick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, heap of wrath, foul indigested lump,</div>
                     <div class="line">As crooked in thy manners as thy shape!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, we shall heat you thoroughly anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Take heed, lest by your heat you burn yourselves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Warwick, hath thy knee forgot to bow?</div>
                     <div class="line">Old Salisbury, shame to thy silver hair,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mad misleader of thy brain-sick son!</div>
                     <div class="line">What, wilt thou on thy death-bed play the ruffian,</div>
                     <div class="line">And seek for sorrow with thy spectacles?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, where is faith? O, where is loyalty?</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be banish'd from the frosty head,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where shall it find a harbour in the earth?</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou go dig a grave to find out war,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shame thine honourable age with blood?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why art thou old, and want'st experience?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or wherefore dost abuse it, if thou hast it?</div>
                     <div class="line">For shame! in duty bend thy knee to me</div>
                     <div class="line">That bows unto the grave with mickle age.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I have consider'd with myself</div>
                     <div class="line">The title of this most renowned duke;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in my conscience do repute his grace</div>
                     <div class="line">The rightful heir to England's royal seat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou not sworn allegiance unto me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">I have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Canst thou dispense with heaven for such an oath?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">It is great sin to swear unto a sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">But greater sin to keep a sinful oath.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who can be bound by any solemn vow</div>
                     <div class="line">To do a murderous deed, to rob a man,</div>
                     <div class="line">To force a spotless virgin's chastity,</div>
                     <div class="line">To reave the orphan of his patrimony,</div>
                     <div class="line">To wring the widow from her custom'd right,</div>
                     <div class="line">And have no other reason for this wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">But that he was bound by a solemn oath?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">A subtle traitor needs no sophister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Call Buckingham, and bid him arm himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Call Buckingham, and all the friends thou hast,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am resolved for death or dignity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">The first I warrant thee, if dreams prove true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">You were best to go to bed and dream again,</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep thee from the tempest of the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">I am resolved to bear a greater storm</div>
                     <div class="line">Than any thou canst conjure up to-day;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that I'll write upon thy burgonet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Might I but know thee by thy household badge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by my father's badge, old Nevil's crest,</div>
                     <div class="line">The rampant bear chain'd to the ragged staff,</div>
                     <div class="line">This day I'll wear aloft my burgonet,</div>
                     <div class="line">As on a mountain top the cedar shows</div>
                     <div class="line">That keeps his leaves in spite of any storm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to affright thee with the view thereof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">And from thy burgonet I'll rend thy bear</div>
                     <div class="line">And tread it under foot with all contempt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despite the bear-ward that protects the bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YOUNG CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">And so to arms, victorious father,</div>
                     <div class="line">To quell the rebels and their complices.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie! charity, for shame! speak not in spite,</div>
                     <div class="line">For you shall sup with Jesu Christ to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YOUNG CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Foul stigmatic, that's more than thou canst tell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">If not in heaven, you'll surely sup in hell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Saint Alban's.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums to the battle. Enter WARWICK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Clifford of Cumberland, 'tis Warwick calls:</div>
                     <div class="line">And if thou dost not hide thee from the bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, when the angry trumpet sounds alarum</div>
                     <div class="line">And dead men's cries do fill the empty air,</div>
                     <div class="line">Clifford, I say, come forth and fight with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Proud northern lord, Clifford of Cumberland,</div>
                     <div class="line">Warwick is hoarse with calling thee to arms.</div>
                     <p>Enter YORK</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, my noble lord? what, all afoot?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">The deadly-handed Clifford slew my steed,</div>
                     <div class="line">But match to match I have encounter'd him</div>
                     <div class="line">And made a prey for carrion kites and crows</div>
                     <div class="line">Even of the bonny beast he loved so well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CLIFFORD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Of one or both of us the time is come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, Warwick, seek thee out some other chase,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I myself must hunt this deer to death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, nobly, York; 'tis for a crown thou fight'st.</div>
                     <div class="line">As I intend, Clifford, to thrive to-day,</div>
                     <div class="line">It grieves my soul to leave thee unassail'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">What seest thou in me, York? why dost thou pause?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">With thy brave bearing should I be in love,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that thou art so fast mine enemy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor should thy prowess want praise and esteem,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that 'tis shown ignobly and in treason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">So let it help me now against thy sword</div>
                     <div class="line">As I in justice and true right express it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">My soul and body on the action both!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">A dreadful lay! Address thee instantly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They fight, and CLIFFORD falls</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">La fin couronne les oeuvres.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus war hath given thee peace, for thou art still.</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace with his soul, heaven, if it be thy will!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter YOUNG CLIFFORD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YOUNG CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Shame and confusion! all is on the rout;</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear frames disorder, and disorder wounds</div>
                     <div class="line">Where it should guard. O war, thou son of hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom angry heavens do make their minister</div>
                     <div class="line">Throw in the frozen bosoms of our part</div>
                     <div class="line">Hot coals of vengeance! Let no soldier fly.</div>
                     <div class="line">He that is truly dedicate to war</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath no self-love, nor he that loves himself</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not essentially but by circumstance</div>
                     <div class="line">The name of valour.</div>
                     <p>Seeing his dead father</p>
                     <div class="line">O, let the vile world end,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the premised flames of the last day</div>
                     <div class="line">Knit earth and heaven together!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now let the general trumpet blow his blast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Particularities and petty sounds</div>
                     <div class="line">To cease! Wast thou ordain'd, dear father,</div>
                     <div class="line">To lose thy youth in peace, and to achieve</div>
                     <div class="line">The silver livery of advised age,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in thy reverence and thy chair-days, thus</div>
                     <div class="line">To die in ruffian battle? Even at this sight</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart is turn'd to stone: and while 'tis mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall be stony. York not our old men spares;</div>
                     <div class="line">No more will I their babes: tears virginal</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be to me even as the dew to fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">And beauty that the tyrant oft reclaims</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall to my flaming wrath be oil and flax.</div>
                     <div class="line">Henceforth I will not have to do with pity:</div>
                     <div class="line">Meet I an infant of the house of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">Into as many gobbets will I cut it</div>
                     <div class="line">As wild Medea young Absyrtus did:</div>
                     <div class="line">In cruelty will I seek out my fame.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, thou new ruin of old Clifford's house:</div>
                     <div class="line">As did AEneas old Anchises bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">So bear I thee upon my manly shoulders;</div>
                     <div class="line">But then AEneas bare a living load,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing so heavy as these woes of mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, bearing off his father</p>
               <p>Enter RICHARD and SOMERSET to fight. SOMERSET
is killed</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">So, lie thou there;</div>
                     <div class="line">For underneath an alehouse' paltry sign,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Castle in Saint Alban's, Somerset</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath made the wizard famous in his death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sword, hold thy temper; heart, be wrathful still:</div>
                     <div class="line">Priests pray for enemies, but princes kill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Fight: excursions. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN
MARGARET, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, my lord! you are slow; for shame, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Can we outrun the heavens? good Margaret, stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">What are you made of? you'll nor fight nor fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now is it manhood, wisdom and defence,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give the enemy way, and to secure us</div>
                     <div class="line">By what we can, which can no more but fly.</div>
                     <p>Alarum afar off</p>
                     <div class="line">If you be ta'en, we then should see the bottom</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all our fortunes: but if we haply scape,</div>
                     <div class="line">As well we may, if not through your neglect,</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall to London get, where you are loved</div>
                     <div class="line">And where this breach now in our fortunes made</div>
                     <div class="line">May readily be stopp'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter YOUNG CLIFFORD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YOUNG CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">But that my heart's on future mischief set,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would speak blasphemy ere bid you fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">But fly you must; uncurable discomfit</div>
                     <div class="line">Reigns in the hearts of all our present parts.</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, for your relief! and we will live</div>
                     <div class="line">To see their day and them our fortune give:</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, my lord, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Retreat. Enter YORK, RICHARD, WARWICK,
and Soldiers, with drum and colours</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Salisbury, who can report of him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That winter lion, who in rage forgets</div>
                     <div class="line">Aged contusions and all brush of time,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a gallant in the brow of youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Repairs him with occasion? This happy day</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not itself, nor have we won one foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">If Salisbury be lost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble father,</div>
                     <div class="line">Three times to-day I holp him to his horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Three times bestrid him; thrice I led him off,</div>
                     <div class="line">Persuaded him from any further act:</div>
                     <div class="line">But still, where danger was, still there I met him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And like rich hangings in a homely house,</div>
                     <div class="line">So was his will in his old feeble body.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, noble as he is, look where he comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SALISBURY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by my sword, well hast thou fought to-day;</div>
                     <div class="line">By the mass, so did we all. I thank you, Richard:</div>
                     <div class="line">God knows how long it is I have to live;</div>
                     <div class="line">And it hath pleased him that three times to-day</div>
                     <div class="line">You have defended me from imminent death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, lords, we have not got that which we have:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not enough our foes are this time fled,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being opposites of such repairing nature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I know our safety is to follow them;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, as I hear, the king is fled to London,</div>
                     <div class="line">To call a present court of parliament.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us pursue him ere the writs go forth.</div>
                     <div class="line">What says Lord Warwick? shall we after them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">After them! nay, before them, if we can.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by my faith, lords, 'twas a glorious day:</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint Alban's battle won by famous York</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be eternized in all age to come.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sound drums and trumpets, and to London all:</div>
                     <div class="line">And more such days as these to us befall!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

         </header>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                        <li>

                           </span>

                        <li>
                           <span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.11">10. SCENE X.  Kent. IDEN's garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Saint Alban's.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">KING HENRY the Sixth</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HUMPHREY, Duke of Gloucester, his uncle. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CARDINAL BEAUFORT, Bishop of Winchester, great-uncle to the King.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">RICHARD PLANTAGENET, Duke of York. </span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">EDWARD</span>
                              <span class="personname">RICHARD</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">his sons</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF SOMERSET</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF SUFFOLK</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF BUCKINGHAM</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LORD CLIFFORD</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">YOUNG CLIFFORD, his son.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF SALISBURY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF WARWICK</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LORD SCALES</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LORD SAY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR HUMPHREY STAFFORD</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">WILLIAM STAFFORD, Sir Humphrey Stafford's brother.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR JOHN STANLEY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">VAUX</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MATTHEW GOFFE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Sea-captain, Master, and Master's-Mate.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">WALTER WHITMORE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Two Gentlemen, prisoners with Suffolk.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">JOHN HUME </span>
                              <span class="personname">JOHN SOUTHWELL</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">priests.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BOLINGBROKE, a conjurer.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">THOMAS HORNER, an armourer. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PETER, Thomas Horner's man.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Clerk of Chatham. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Mayor of Saint Alban's. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIMPCOX, an impostor.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ALEXANDER IDEN, a Kentish gentleman. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">JACK CADE, a rebel. </span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">GEORGE BEVIS</span>
                              <span class="personname">JOHN HOLLAND</span>
                              <span class="personname">DICK the butcher</span>
                              <span class="personname">SMITH the weaver</span>
                              <span class="personname">MICHAEL</span>
                              <span class="personname">&c.</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">followers of Cade.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Two Murderers</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">QUEEN MARGARET, Queen to King Henry.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ELEANOR, Duchess of Gloucester. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MARGARET JOURDAIN, a witch.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Wife to Simpcox  </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lords, Ladies, and Attendants. Petitioners, Aldermen, a Herald, a Beadle, Sheriff, and Officers, Citizens, 'Prentices, Falconers, Guards, Soldiers, Messengers, &c.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Spirit. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  England.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  GLOUCESTER'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  GLOUCESTER's garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish of trumpets: then hautboys. Enter KING
HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and
CARDINAL, on the one side; QUEEN MARGARET, SUFFOLK,
YORK, SOMERSET, and BUCKINGHAM, on the other</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">As by your high imperial majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">I had in charge at my depart for France,</div>
                              <div class="line">As procurator to your excellence,</div>
                              <div class="line">To marry Princess Margaret for your grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">So, in the famous ancient city, Tours,</div>
                              <div class="line">In presence of the Kings of France and Sicil,</div>
                              <div class="line">The Dukes of Orleans, Calaber, Bretagne and Alencon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seven earls, twelve barons and twenty reverend bishops,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have perform'd my task and was espoused:</div>
                              <div class="line">And humbly now upon my bended knee,</div>
                              <div class="line">In sight of England and her lordly peers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Deliver up my title in the queen</div>
                              <div class="line">To your most gracious hands, that are the substance</div>
                              <div class="line">Of that great shadow I did represent;</div>
                              <div class="line">The happiest gift that ever marquess gave,</div>
                              <div class="line">The fairest queen that ever king received.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Suffolk, arise. Welcome, Queen Margaret:</div>
                              <div class="line">I can express no kinder sign of love</div>
                              <div class="line">Than this kind kiss. O Lord, that lends me life,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lend me a heart replete with thankfulness!</div>
                              <div class="line">For thou hast given me in this beauteous face</div>
                              <div class="line">A world of earthly blessings to my soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">If sympathy of love unite our thoughts.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Great King of England and my gracious lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">The mutual conference that my mind hath had,</div>
                              <div class="line">By day, by night, waking and in my dreams,</div>
                              <div class="line">In courtly company or at my beads,</div>
                              <div class="line">With you, mine alder-liefest sovereign,</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes me the bolder to salute my king</div>
                              <div class="line">With ruder terms, such as my wit affords</div>
                              <div class="line">And over-joy of heart doth minister.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Her sight did ravish; but her grace in speech,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her words y-clad with wisdom's majesty,</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes me from wondering fall to weeping joys;</div>
                              <div class="line">Such is the fulness of my heart's content.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lords, with one cheerful voice welcome my love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Kneeling</span>  Long live Queen Margaret, England's</div>
                              <div class="line">happiness!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">We thank you all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord protector, so it please your grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here are the articles of contracted peace</div>
                              <div class="line">Between our sovereign and the French king Charles,</div>
                              <div class="line">For eighteen months concluded by consent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>  'Imprimis, it is agreed between the French</div>
                              <div class="line">king Charles, and William de la Pole, Marquess of</div>
                              <div class="line">Suffolk, ambassador for Henry King of England, that</div>
                              <div class="line">the said Henry shall espouse the Lady Margaret,</div>
                              <div class="line">daughter unto Reignier King of Naples, Sicilia and</div>
                              <div class="line">Jerusalem, and crown her Queen of England ere the</div>
                              <div class="line">thirtieth of May next ensuing. Item, that the duchy</div>
                              <div class="line">of Anjou and the county of Maine shall be released</div>
                              <div class="line">and delivered to the king her father'--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Lets the paper fall</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Uncle, how now!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, gracious lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">Some sudden qualm hath struck me at the heart</div>
                              <div class="line">And dimm'd mine eyes, that I can read no further.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Uncle of Winchester, I pray, read on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>  'Item, It is further agreed between them,</div>
                              <div class="line">that the duchies of Anjou and Maine shall be</div>
                              <div class="line">released and delivered over to the king her father,</div>
                              <div class="line">and she sent over of the King of England's own</div>
                              <div class="line">proper cost and charges, without having any dowry.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">They please us well. Lord marquess, kneel down:</div>
                              <div class="line">We here create thee the first duke of Suffolk,</div>
                              <div class="line">And gird thee with the sword. Cousin of York,</div>
                              <div class="line">We here discharge your grace from being regent</div>
                              <div class="line">I' the parts of France, till term of eighteen months</div>
                              <div class="line">Be full expired. Thanks, uncle Winchester,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester, York, Buckingham, Somerset,</div>
                              <div class="line">Salisbury, and Warwick;</div>
                              <div class="line">We thank you all for the great favour done,</div>
                              <div class="line">In entertainment to my princely queen.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, let us in, and with all speed provide</div>
                              <div class="line">To see her coronation be perform'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt KING HENRY VI, QUEEN MARGARET, and SUFFOLK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave peers of England, pillars of the state,</div>
                              <div class="line">To you Duke Humphrey must unload his grief,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grief, the common grief of all the land.</div>
                              <div class="line">What! did my brother Henry spend his youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">His valour, coin and people, in the wars?</div>
                              <div class="line">Did he so often lodge in open field,</div>
                              <div class="line">In winter's cold and summer's parching heat,</div>
                              <div class="line">To conquer France, his true inheritance?</div>
                              <div class="line">And did my brother Bedford toil his wits,</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep by policy what Henry got?</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you yourselves, Somerset, Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave York, Salisbury, and victorious Warwick,</div>
                              <div class="line">Received deep scars in France and Normandy?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or hath mine uncle Beaufort and myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">With all the learned council of the realm,</div>
                              <div class="line">Studied so long, sat in the council-house</div>
                              <div class="line">Early and late, debating to and fro</div>
                              <div class="line">How France and Frenchmen might be kept in awe,</div>
                              <div class="line">And had his highness in his infancy</div>
                              <div class="line">Crowned in Paris in despite of foes?</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall these labours and these honours die?</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall Henry's conquest, Bedford's vigilance,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your deeds of war and all our counsel die?</div>
                              <div class="line">O peers of England, shameful is this league!</div>
                              <div class="line">Fatal this marriage, cancelling your fame,</div>
                              <div class="line">Blotting your names from books of memory,</div>
                              <div class="line">Razing the characters of your renown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Defacing monuments of conquer'd France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Undoing all, as all had never been!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">Nephew, what means this passionate discourse,</div>
                              <div class="line">This peroration with such circumstance?</div>
                              <div class="line">For France, 'tis ours; and we will keep it still.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, uncle, we will keep it, if we can;</div>
                              <div class="line">But now it is impossible we should:</div>
                              <div class="line">Suffolk, the new-made duke that rules the roast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath given the duchy of Anjou and Maine</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the poor King Reignier, whose large style</div>
                              <div class="line">Agrees not with the leanness of his purse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by the death of Him that died for all,</div>
                              <div class="line">These counties were the keys of Normandy.</div>
                              <div class="line">But wherefore weeps Warwick, my valiant son?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">For grief that they are past recovery:</div>
                              <div class="line">For, were there hope to conquer them again,</div>
                              <div class="line">My sword should shed hot blood, mine eyes no tears.</div>
                              <div class="line">Anjou and Maine! myself did win them both;</div>
                              <div class="line">Those provinces these arms of mine did conquer:</div>
                              <div class="line">And are the cities, that I got with wounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Delivered up again with peaceful words?</div>
                              <div class="line">Mort Dieu!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">For Suffolk's duke, may he be suffocate,</div>
                              <div class="line">That dims the honour of this warlike isle!</div>
                              <div class="line">France should have torn and rent my very heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before I would have yielded to this league.</div>
                              <div class="line">I never read but England's kings have had</div>
                              <div class="line">Large sums of gold and dowries with their wives:</div>
                              <div class="line">And our King Henry gives away his own,</div>
                              <div class="line">To match with her that brings no vantages.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">A proper jest, and never heard before,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Suffolk should demand a whole fifteenth</div>
                              <div class="line">For costs and charges in transporting her!</div>
                              <div class="line">She should have stayed in France and starved</div>
                              <div class="line">in France, Before--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Gloucester, now ye grow too hot:</div>
                              <div class="line">It was the pleasure of my lord the King.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Winchester, I know your mind;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not my speeches that you do mislike,</div>
                              <div class="line">But 'tis my presence that doth trouble ye.</div>
                              <div class="line">Rancour will out: proud prelate, in thy face</div>
                              <div class="line">I see thy fury: if I longer stay,</div>
                              <div class="line">We shall begin our ancient bickerings.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lordings, farewell; and say, when I am gone,</div>
                              <div class="line">I prophesied France will be lost ere long.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">So, there goes our protector in a rage.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis known to you he is mine enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, more, an enemy unto you all,</div>
                              <div class="line">And no great friend, I fear me, to the king.</div>
                              <div class="line">Consider, lords, he is the next of blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">And heir apparent to the English crown:</div>
                              <div class="line">Had Henry got an empire by his marriage,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the wealthy kingdoms of the west,</div>
                              <div class="line">There's reason he should be displeased at it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Look to it, lords! let not his smoothing words</div>
                              <div class="line">Bewitch your hearts; be wise and circumspect.</div>
                              <div class="line">What though the common people favour him,</div>
                              <div class="line">Calling him 'Humphrey, the good Duke of</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester,'</div>
                              <div class="line">Clapping their hands, and crying with loud voice,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Jesu maintain your royal excellence!'</div>
                              <div class="line">With 'God preserve the good Duke Humphrey!'</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear me, lords, for all this flattering gloss,</div>
