                              <div class="line">Ah, Gloucester, hide thee from their hateful looks,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in thy closet pent up, rue my shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ban thine enemies, both mine and thine!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Be patient, gentle Nell; forget this grief.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Gloucester, teach me to forget myself!</div>
                              <div class="line">For whilst I think I am thy married wife</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou a prince, protector of this land,</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks I should not thus be led along,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mail'd up in shame, with papers on my back,</div>
                              <div class="line">And followed with a rabble that rejoice</div>
                              <div class="line">To see my tears and hear my deep-fet groans.</div>
                              <div class="line">The ruthless flint doth cut my tender feet,</div>
                              <div class="line">And when I start, the envious people laugh</div>
                              <div class="line">And bid me be advised how I tread.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Humphrey, can I bear this shameful yoke?</div>
                              <div class="line">Trow'st thou that e'er I'll look upon the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or count them happy that enjoy the sun?</div>
                              <div class="line">No; dark shall be my light and night my day;</div>
                              <div class="line">To think upon my pomp shall be my hell.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sometime I'll say, I am Duke Humphrey's wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">And he a prince and ruler of the land:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet so he ruled and such a prince he was</div>
                              <div class="line">As he stood by whilst I, his forlorn duchess,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was made a wonder and a pointing-stock</div>
                              <div class="line">To every idle rascal follower.</div>
                              <div class="line">But be thou mild and blush not at my shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor stir at nothing till the axe of death</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang over thee, as, sure, it shortly will;</div>
                              <div class="line">For Suffolk, he that can do all in all</div>
                              <div class="line">With her that hateth thee and hates us all,</div>
                              <div class="line">And York and impious Beaufort, that false priest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have all limed bushes to betray thy wings,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, fly thou how thou canst, they'll tangle thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">But fear not thou, until thy foot be snared,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor never seek prevention of thy foes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Nell, forbear! thou aimest all awry;</div>
                              <div class="line">I must offend before I be attainted;</div>
                              <div class="line">And had I twenty times so many foes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And each of them had twenty times their power,</div>
                              <div class="line">All these could not procure me any scathe,</div>
                              <div class="line">So long as I am loyal, true and crimeless.</div>
                              <div class="line">Wouldst have me rescue thee from this reproach?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, yet thy scandal were not wiped away</div>
                              <div class="line">But I in danger for the breach of law.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy greatest help is quiet, gentle Nell:</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, sort thy heart to patience;</div>
                              <div class="line">These few days' wonder will be quickly worn.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Herald</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Herald</div>
                              <div class="line">I summon your grace to his majesty's parliament,</div>
                              <div class="line">Holden at Bury the first of this next month.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And my consent ne'er ask'd herein before!</div>
                              <div class="line">This is close dealing. Well, I will be there.</div>
                              <p>Exit Herald</p>
                              <div class="line">My Nell, I take my leave: and, master sheriff,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not her penance exceed the king's commission.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">An't please your grace, here my commission stays,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Sir John Stanley is appointed now</div>
                              <div class="line">To take her with him to the Isle of Man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Must you, Sir John, protect my lady here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STANLEY</div>
                              <div class="line">So am I given in charge, may't please your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Entreat her not the worse in that I pray</div>
                              <div class="line">You use her well: the world may laugh again;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I may live to do you kindness if</div>
                              <div class="line">You do it her: and so, Sir John, farewell!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                              <div class="line">What, gone, my lord, and bid me not farewell!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Witness my tears, I cannot stay to speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt GLOUCESTER and Servingmen</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                              <div class="line">Art thou gone too? all comfort go with thee!</div>
                              <div class="line">For none abides with me: my joy is death;</div>
                              <div class="line">Death, at whose name I oft have been afear'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because I wish'd this world's eternity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stanley, I prithee, go, and take me hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">I care not whither, for I beg no favour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Only convey me where thou art commanded.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STANLEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, madam, that is to the Isle of Man;</div>
                              <div class="line">There to be used according to your state.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's bad enough, for I am but reproach:</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall I then be used reproachfully?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STANLEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to a duchess, and Duke Humphrey's lady;</div>
                              <div class="line">According to that state you shall be used.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sheriff, farewell, and better than I fare,</div>
                              <div class="line">Although thou hast been conduct of my shame.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">It is my office; and, madam, pardon me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, ay, farewell; thy office is discharged.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Stanley, shall we go?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STANLEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, your penance done, throw off this sheet,</div>
                              <div class="line">And go we to attire you for our journey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS</div>
                              <div class="line">My shame will not be shifted with my sheet:</div>
                              <div class="line">No, it will hang upon my richest robes</div>
                              <div class="line">And show itself, attire me how I can.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, lead the way; I long to see my prison.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  A bedchamber.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Sound a sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN
MARGARET, CARDINAL, SUFFOLK, YORK, BUCKINGHAM,
SALISBURY and WARWICK to the Parliament</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">I muse my Lord of Gloucester is not come:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not his wont to be the hindmost man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whate'er occasion keeps him from us now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Can you not see? or will ye not observe</div>
                              <div class="line">The strangeness of his alter'd countenance?</div>
                              <div class="line">With what a majesty he bears himself,</div>
                              <div class="line">How insolent of late he is become,</div>
                              <div class="line">How proud, how peremptory, and unlike himself?</div>
                              <div class="line">We know the time since he was mild and affable,</div>
                              <div class="line">And if we did but glance a far-off look,</div>
                              <div class="line">Immediately he was upon his knee,</div>
                              <div class="line">That all the court admired him for submission:</div>
                              <div class="line">But meet him now, and, be it in the morn,</div>
                              <div class="line">When every one will give the time of day,</div>
                              <div class="line">He knits his brow and shows an angry eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">And passeth by with stiff unbowed knee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Disdaining duty that to us belongs.</div>
                              <div class="line">Small curs are not regarded when they grin;</div>
                              <div class="line">But great men tremble when the lion roars;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Humphrey is no little man in England.</div>
                              <div class="line">First note that he is near you in descent,</div>
                              <div class="line">And should you fall, he as the next will mount.</div>
                              <div class="line">Me seemeth then it is no policy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Respecting what a rancorous mind he bears</div>
                              <div class="line">And his advantage following your decease,</div>
                              <div class="line">That he should come about your royal person</div>
                              <div class="line">Or be admitted to your highness' council.</div>
                              <div class="line">By flattery hath he won the commons' hearts,</div>
                              <div class="line">And when he please to make commotion,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis to be fear'd they all will follow him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now 'tis the spring, and weeds are shallow-rooted;</div>
                              <div class="line">Suffer them now, and they'll o'ergrow the garden</div>
                              <div class="line">And choke the herbs for want of husbandry.</div>
                              <div class="line">The reverent care I bear unto my lord</div>
                              <div class="line">Made me collect these dangers in the duke.</div>
                              <div class="line">If it be fond, call it a woman's fear;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which fear if better reasons can supplant,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will subscribe and say I wrong'd the duke.</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Suffolk, Buckingham, and York,</div>
                              <div class="line">Reprove my allegation, if you can;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else conclude my words effectual.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Well hath your highness seen into this duke;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, had I first been put to speak my mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">I think I should have told your grace's tale.</div>
                              <div class="line">The duchess, by his subornation,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my life, began her devilish practises:</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, if he were not privy to those faults,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, by reputing of his high descent,</div>
                              <div class="line">As next the king he was successive heir,</div>
                              <div class="line">And such high vaunts of his nobility,</div>
                              <div class="line">Did instigate the bedlam brain-sick duchess</div>
                              <div class="line">By wicked means to frame our sovereign's fall.</div>
                              <div class="line">Smooth runs the water where the brook is deep;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in his simple show he harbours treason.</div>
                              <div class="line">The fox barks not when he would steal the lamb.</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no, my sovereign; Gloucester is a man</div>
                              <div class="line">Unsounded yet and full of deep deceit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">Did he not, contrary to form of law,</div>
                              <div class="line">Devise strange deaths for small offences done?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">And did he not, in his protectorship,</div>
                              <div class="line">Levy great sums of money through the realm</div>
                              <div class="line">For soldiers' pay in France, and never sent it?</div>
                              <div class="line">By means whereof the towns each day revolted.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Tut, these are petty faults to faults unknown.</div>
                              <div class="line">Which time will bring to light in smooth</div>
                              <div class="line">Duke Humphrey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">My lords, at once: the care you have of us,</div>
                              <div class="line">To mow down thorns that would annoy our foot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is worthy praise: but, shall I speak my conscience,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our kinsman Gloucester is as innocent</div>
                              <div class="line">From meaning treason to our royal person</div>
                              <div class="line">As is the sucking lamb or harmless dove:</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke is virtuous, mild and too well given</div>
                              <div class="line">To dream on evil or to work my downfall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, what's more dangerous than this fond affiance!</div>
                              <div class="line">Seems he a dove? his feathers are but borrowed,</div>
                              <div class="line">For he's disposed as the hateful raven:</div>
                              <div class="line">Is he a lamb? his skin is surely lent him,</div>
                              <div class="line">For he's inclined as is the ravenous wolf.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who cannot steal a shape that means deceit?</div>
                              <div class="line">Take heed, my lord; the welfare of us all</div>
                              <div class="line">Hangs on the cutting short that fraudful man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter SOMERSET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">All health unto my gracious sovereign!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, Lord Somerset. What news from France?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">That all your interest in those territories</div>
                              <div class="line">Is utterly bereft you; all is lost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Cold news, Lord Somerset: but God's will be done!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Cold news for me; for I had hope of France</div>
                              <div class="line">As firmly as I hope for fertile England.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus are my blossoms blasted in the bud</div>
                              <div class="line">And caterpillars eat my leaves away;</div>
                              <div class="line">But I will remedy this gear ere long,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or sell my title for a glorious grave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">All happiness unto my lord the king!</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon, my liege, that I have stay'd so long.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, Gloucester, know that thou art come too soon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless thou wert more loyal than thou art:</div>
                              <div class="line">I do arrest thee of high treason here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, Suffolk, thou shalt not see me blush</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor change my countenance for this arrest:</div>
                              <div class="line">A heart unspotted is not easily daunted.</div>
                              <div class="line">The purest spring is not so free from mud</div>
                              <div class="line">As I am clear from treason to my sovereign:</div>
                              <div class="line">Who can accuse me? wherein am I guilty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis thought, my lord, that you took bribes of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, being protector, stayed the soldiers' pay;</div>
                              <div class="line">By means whereof his highness hath lost France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it but thought so? what are they that think it?</div>
                              <div class="line">I never robb'd the soldiers of their pay,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor ever had one penny bribe from France.</div>
                              <div class="line">So help me God, as I have watch'd the night,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, night by night, in studying good for England,</div>
                              <div class="line">That doit that e'er I wrested from the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or any groat I hoarded to my use,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be brought against me at my trial-day!</div>
                              <div class="line">No; many a pound of mine own proper store,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because I would not tax the needy commons,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I disbursed to the garrisons,</div>
                              <div class="line">And never ask'd for restitution.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">It serves you well, my lord, to say so much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I say no more than truth, so help me God!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">In your protectorship you did devise</div>
                              <div class="line">Strange tortures for offenders never heard of,</div>
                              <div class="line">That England was defamed by tyranny.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, 'tis well known that, whiles I was</div>
                              <div class="line">protector,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pity was all the fault that was in me;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I should melt at an offender's tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lowly words were ransom for their fault.</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless it were a bloody murderer,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or foul felonious thief that fleeced poor passengers,</div>
                              <div class="line">I never gave them condign punishment:</div>
                              <div class="line">Murder indeed, that bloody sin, I tortured</div>
                              <div class="line">Above the felon or what trespass else.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, these faults are easy, quickly answered:</div>
                              <div class="line">But mightier crimes are laid unto your charge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereof you cannot easily purge yourself.</div>
                              <div class="line">I do arrest you in his highness' name;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here commit you to my lord cardinal</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep, until your further time of trial.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord of Gloucester, 'tis my special hope</div>
                              <div class="line">That you will clear yourself from all suspect:</div>
                              <div class="line">My conscience tells me you are innocent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, gracious lord, these days are dangerous:</div>
                              <div class="line">Virtue is choked with foul ambition</div>
                              <div class="line">And charity chased hence by rancour's hand;</div>
                              <div class="line">Foul subornation is predominant</div>
                              <div class="line">And equity exiled your highness' land.</div>
                              <div class="line">I know their complot is to have my life,</div>
                              <div class="line">And if my death might make this island happy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And prove the period of their tyranny,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would expend it with all willingness:</div>
                              <div class="line">But mine is made the prologue to their play;</div>
                              <div class="line">For thousands more, that yet suspect no peril,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will not conclude their plotted tragedy.</div>
                              <div class="line">Beaufort's red sparkling eyes blab his heart's malice,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Suffolk's cloudy brow his stormy hate;</div>
                              <div class="line">Sharp Buckingham unburthens with his tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">The envious load that lies upon his heart;</div>
                              <div class="line">And dogged York, that reaches at the moon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose overweening arm I have pluck'd back,</div>
                              <div class="line">By false accuse doth level at my life:</div>
                              <div class="line">And you, my sovereign lady, with the rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Causeless have laid disgraces on my head,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with your best endeavour have stirr'd up</div>
                              <div class="line">My liefest liege to be mine enemy:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, all you have laid your heads together--</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself had notice of your conventicles--</div>
                              <div class="line">And all to make away my guiltless life.</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall not want false witness to condemn me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor store of treasons to augment my guilt;</div>
                              <div class="line">The ancient proverb will be well effected:</div>
                              <div class="line">'A staff is quickly found to beat a dog.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">My liege, his railing is intolerable:</div>
                              <div class="line">If those that care to keep your royal person</div>
                              <div class="line">From treason's secret knife and traitors' rage</div>
                              <div class="line">Be thus upbraided, chid and rated at,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the offender granted scope of speech,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twill make them cool in zeal unto your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath he not twit our sovereign lady here</div>
                              <div class="line">With ignominious words, though clerkly couch'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if she had suborned some to swear</div>
                              <div class="line">False allegations to o'erthrow his state?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">But I can give the loser leave to chide.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Far truer spoke than meant: I lose, indeed;</div>
                              <div class="line">Beshrew the winners, for they play'd me false!</div>
                              <div class="line">And well such losers may have leave to speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">He'll wrest the sense and hold us here all day:</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord cardinal, he is your prisoner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirs, take away the duke, and guard him sure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah! thus King Henry throws away his crutch</div>
                              <div class="line">Before his legs be firm to bear his body.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus is the shepherd beaten from thy side,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wolves are gnarling who shall gnaw thee first.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, that my fear were false! ah, that it were!</div>
                              <div class="line">For, good King Henry, thy decay I fear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit, guarded</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">My lords, what to your wisdoms seemeth best,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do or undo, as if ourself were here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">What, will your highness leave the parliament?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, Margaret; my heart is drown'd with grief,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose flood begins to flow within mine eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">My body round engirt with misery,</div>
                              <div class="line">For what's more miserable than discontent?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, uncle Humphrey! in thy face I see</div>
                              <div class="line">The map of honour, truth and loyalty:</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet, good Humphrey, is the hour to come</div>
                              <div class="line">That e'er I proved thee false or fear'd thy faith.</div>
                              <div class="line">What louring star now envies thy estate,</div>
                              <div class="line">That these great lords and Margaret our queen</div>
                              <div class="line">Do seek subversion of thy harmless life?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou never didst them wrong, nor no man wrong;</div>
                              <div class="line">And as the butcher takes away the calf</div>
                              <div class="line">And binds the wretch, and beats it when it strays,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bearing it to the bloody slaughter-house,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even so remorseless have they borne him hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">And as the dam runs lowing up and down,</div>
                              <div class="line">Looking the way her harmless young one went,</div>
                              <div class="line">And can do nought but wail her darling's loss,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even so myself bewails good Gloucester's case</div>
                              <div class="line">With sad unhelpful tears, and with dimm'd eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">Look after him and cannot do him good,</div>
                              <div class="line">So mighty are his vowed enemies.</div>
                              <div class="line">His fortunes I will weep; and, 'twixt each groan</div>
                              <div class="line">Say 'Who's a traitor? Gloucester he is none.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but QUEEN MARGARET, CARDINAL,
SUFFOLK, and YORK; SOMERSET remains apart</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Free lords, cold snow melts with the sun's hot beams.</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry my lord is cold in great affairs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Too full of foolish pity, and Gloucester's show</div>
                              <div class="line">Beguiles him as the mournful crocodile</div>
                              <div class="line">With sorrow snares relenting passengers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or as the snake roll'd in a flowering bank,</div>
                              <div class="line">With shining chequer'd slough, doth sting a child</div>
                              <div class="line">That for the beauty thinks it excellent.</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe me, lords, were none more wise than I--</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet herein I judge mine own wit good--</div>
                              <div class="line">This Gloucester should be quickly rid the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">To rid us of the fear we have of him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">That he should die is worthy policy;</div>
                              <div class="line">But yet we want a colour for his death:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis meet he be condemn'd by course of law.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">But, in my mind, that were no policy:</div>
                              <div class="line">The king will labour still to save his life,</div>
                              <div class="line">The commons haply rise, to save his life;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet we have but trivial argument,</div>
                              <div class="line">More than mistrust, that shows him worthy death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">So that, by this, you would not have him die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, York, no man alive so fain as I!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis York that hath more reason for his death.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, my lord cardinal, and you, my Lord of Suffolk,</div>
                              <div class="line">Say as you think, and speak it from your souls,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were't not all one, an empty eagle were set</div>
                              <div class="line">To guard the chicken from a hungry kite,</div>
                              <div class="line">As place Duke Humphrey for the king's protector?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">So the poor chicken should be sure of death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, 'tis true; and were't not madness, then,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make the fox surveyor of the fold?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who being accused a crafty murderer,</div>
                              <div class="line">His guilt should be but idly posted over,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because his purpose is not executed.</div>
                              <div class="line">No; let him die, in that he is a fox,</div>
                              <div class="line">By nature proved an enemy to the flock,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before his chaps be stain'd with crimson blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">As Humphrey, proved by reasons, to my liege.</div>
                              <div class="line">And do not stand on quillets how to slay him:</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it by gins, by snares, by subtlety,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleeping or waking, 'tis no matter how,</div>
                              <div class="line">So he be dead; for that is good deceit</div>
                              <div class="line">Which mates him first that first intends deceit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Thrice-noble Suffolk, 'tis resolutely spoke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Not resolute, except so much were done;</div>
                              <div class="line">For things are often spoke and seldom meant:</div>
                              <div class="line">But that my heart accordeth with my tongue,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seeing the deed is meritorious,</div>
                              <div class="line">And to preserve my sovereign from his foe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Say but the word, and I will be his priest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">But I would have him dead, my Lord of Suffolk,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere you can take due orders for a priest:</div>
                              <div class="line">Say you consent and censure well the deed,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll provide his executioner,</div>
                              <div class="line">I tender so the safety of my liege.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is my hand, the deed is worthy doing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And so say I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">And I    and now we three have spoke it,</div>
                              <div class="line">It skills not greatly who impugns our doom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Post</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">Great lords, from Ireland am I come amain,</div>
                              <div class="line">To signify that rebels there are up</div>
                              <div class="line">And put the Englishmen unto the sword:</div>
                              <div class="line">Send succors, lords, and stop the rage betime,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the wound do grow uncurable;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, being green, there is great hope of help.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">A breach that craves a quick expedient stop!</div>
                              <div class="line">What counsel give you in this weighty cause?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">That Somerset be sent as regent thither:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis meet that lucky ruler be employ'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">Witness the fortune he hath had in France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">If York, with all his far-fet policy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had been the regent there instead of me,</div>
                              <div class="line">He never would have stay'd in France so long.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not to lose it all, as thou hast done:</div>
                              <div class="line">I rather would have lost my life betimes</div>
                              <div class="line">Than bring a burthen of dishonour home</div>
                              <div class="line">By staying there so long till all were lost.</div>
                              <div class="line">Show me one scar character'd on thy skin:</div>
                              <div class="line">Men's flesh preserved so whole do seldom win.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, then, this spark will prove a raging fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">If wind and fuel be brought to feed it with:</div>
                              <div class="line">No more, good York; sweet Somerset, be still:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy fortune, York, hadst thou been regent there,</div>
                              <div class="line">Might happily have proved far worse than his.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">What, worse than nought? nay, then, a shame take all!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in the number, thee that wishest shame!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of York, try what your fortune is.</div>
                              <div class="line">The uncivil kerns of Ireland are in arms</div>
                              <div class="line">And temper clay with blood of Englishmen:</div>
                              <div class="line">To Ireland will you lead a band of men,</div>
                              <div class="line">Collected choicely, from each county some,</div>
                              <div class="line">And try your hap against the Irishmen?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">I will, my lord, so please his majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, our authority is his consent,</div>
                              <div class="line">And what we do establish he confirms:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, noble York, take thou this task in hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">I am content: provide me soldiers, lords,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles I take order for mine own affairs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">A charge, Lord York, that I will see perform'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">But now return we to the false Duke Humphrey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">No more of him; for I will deal with him</div>
                              <div class="line">That henceforth he shall trouble us no more.</div>
                              <div class="line">And so break off; the day is almost spent:</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Suffolk, you and I must talk of that event.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Suffolk, within fourteen days</div>
                              <div class="line">At Bristol I expect my soldiers;</div>
                              <div class="line">For there I'll ship them all for Ireland.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll see it truly done, my Lord of York.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but YORK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, York, or never, steel thy fearful thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">And change misdoubt to resolution:</div>
                              <div class="line">Be that thou hopest to be, or what thou art</div>
                              <div class="line">Resign to death; it is not worth the enjoying:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let pale-faced fear keep with the mean-born man,</div>
                              <div class="line">And find no harbour in a royal heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">Faster than spring-time showers comes thought</div>
                              <div class="line">on thought,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not a thought but thinks on dignity.</div>
                              <div class="line">My brain more busy than the labouring spider</div>
                              <div class="line">Weaves tedious snares to trap mine enemies.</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, nobles, well, 'tis politicly done,</div>
                              <div class="line">To send me packing with an host of men:</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear me you but warm the starved snake,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, cherish'd in your breasts, will sting</div>
                              <div class="line">your hearts.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas men I lack'd and you will give them me:</div>
                              <div class="line">I take it kindly; and yet be well assured</div>
                              <div class="line">You put sharp weapons in a madman's hands.</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles I in Ireland nourish a mighty band,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will stir up in England some black storm</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall blow ten thousand souls to heaven or hell;</div>
                              <div class="line">And this fell tempest shall not cease to rage</div>
                              <div class="line">Until the golden circuit on my head,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to the glorious sun's transparent beams,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do calm the fury of this mad-bred flaw.</div>
                              <div class="line">And, for a minister of my intent,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have seduced a headstrong Kentishman,</div>
                              <div class="line">John Cade of Ashford,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make commotion, as full well he can,</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the title of John Mortimer.</div>
                              <div class="line">In Ireland have I seen this stubborn Cade</div>
                              <div class="line">Oppose himself against a troop of kerns,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fought so long, till that his thighs with darts</div>
                              <div class="line">Were almost like a sharp-quill'd porpentine;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in the end being rescued, I have seen</div>
                              <div class="line">Him caper upright like a wild Morisco,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shaking the bloody darts as he his bells.</div>
                              <div class="line">Full often, like a shag-hair'd crafty kern,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath he conversed with the enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And undiscover'd come to me again</div>
                              <div class="line">And given me notice of their villanies.</div>
                              <div class="line">This devil here shall be my substitute;</div>
                              <div class="line">For that John Mortimer, which now is dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">In face, in gait, in speech, he doth resemble:</div>
                              <div class="line">By this I shall perceive the commons' mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">How they affect the house and claim of York.</div>
                              <div class="line">Say he be taken, rack'd and tortured,</div>
                              <div class="line">I know no pain they can inflict upon him</div>
                              <div class="line">Will make him say I moved him to those arms.</div>
                              <div class="line">Say that he thrive, as 'tis great like he will,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then from Ireland come I with my strength</div>
                              <div class="line">And reap the harvest which that rascal sow'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">For Humphrey being dead, as he shall be,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Henry put apart, the next for me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter certain Murderers, hastily</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Run to my Lord of Suffolk; let him know</div>
                              <div class="line">We have dispatch'd the duke, as he commanded.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">O that it were to do! What have we done?</div>
                              <div class="line">Didst ever hear a man so penitent?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter SUFFOLK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murder</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, sirs, have you dispatch'd this thing?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my good lord, he's dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that's well said. Go, get you to my house;</div>
                              <div class="line">I will reward you for this venturous deed.</div>
                              <div class="line">The king and all the peers are here at hand.</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you laid fair the bed? Is all things well,</div>
                              <div class="line">According as I gave directions?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis, my good lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Away! be gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Murderers</p>
                        <p>Sound trumpets. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN
MARGARET, CARDINAL, SOMERSET, with Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, call our uncle to our presence straight;</div>
                              <div class="line">Say we intend to try his grace to-day.</div>
                              <div class="line">If he be guilty, as 'tis published.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll call him presently, my noble lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Lords, take your places; and, I pray you all,</div>
                              <div class="line">Proceed no straiter 'gainst our uncle Gloucester</div>
                              <div class="line">Than from true evidence of good esteem</div>
                              <div class="line">He be approved in practise culpable.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">God forbid any malice should prevail,</div>
                              <div class="line">That faultless may condemn a nobleman!</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray God he may acquit him of suspicion!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee, Meg; these words content me much.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter SUFFOLK</p>
                              <div class="line">How now! why look'st thou pale? why tremblest thou?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is our uncle? what's the matter, Suffolk?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Dead in his bed, my lord; Gloucester is dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, God forfend!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL</div>
                              <div class="line">God's secret judgment: I did dream to-night</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke was dumb and could not speak a word.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>KING HENRY VI swoons</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares my lord? Help, lords! the king is dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Rear up his body; wring him by the nose.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Run, go, help, help! O Henry, ope thine eyes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">He doth revive again: madam, be patient.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">O heavenly God!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares my gracious lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Comfort, my sovereign! gracious Henry, comfort!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">What, doth my Lord of Suffolk comfort me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Came he right now to sing a raven's note,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose dismal tune bereft my vital powers;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thinks he that the chirping of a wren,</div>
                              <div class="line">By crying comfort from a hollow breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Can chase away the first-conceived sound?</div>
                              <div class="line">Hide not thy poison with such sugar'd words;</div>
                              <div class="line">Lay not thy hands on me; forbear, I say;</div>
                              <div class="line">Their touch affrights me as a serpent's sting.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou baleful messenger, out of my sight!</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon thy eye-balls murderous tyranny</div>
                              <div class="line">Sits in grim majesty, to fright the world.</div>
                              <div class="line">Look not upon me, for thine eyes are wounding:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet do not go away: come, basilisk,</div>
                              <div class="line">And kill the innocent gazer with thy sight;</div>
                              <div class="line">For in the shade of death I shall find joy;</div>
                              <div class="line">In life but double death, now Gloucester's dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why do you rate my Lord of Suffolk thus?</div>
                              <div class="line">Although the duke was enemy to him,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet he most Christian-like laments his death:</div>
