                              <div class="line">commodities upon our bills?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, presently.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                              <div class="line">O, brave!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter one with the heads</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">But is not this braver? Let them kiss one another,</div>
                              <div class="line">for they loved well when they were alive. Now part</div>
                              <div class="line">them again, lest they consult about the giving up of</div>
                              <div class="line">some more towns in France. Soldiers, defer the</div>
                              <div class="line">spoil of the city until night: for with these borne</div>
                              <div class="line">before us, instead of maces, will we ride through</div>
                              <div class="line">the streets, and at every corner have them kiss. Away!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.9">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>8. SCENE VIII.  Southwark.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum and retreat. Enter CADE and all his
rabblement</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Up Fish Street! down Saint Magnus' Corner! Kill</div>
                              <div class="line">and knock down! throw them into Thames!</div>
                              <p>Sound a parley</p>
                              <div class="line">What noise is this I hear? Dare any be so bold to</div>
                              <div class="line">sound retreat or parley, when I command them kill?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM and CLIFFORD, attended</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, here they be that dare and will disturb thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Know, Cade, we come ambassadors from the king</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the commons whom thou hast misled;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here pronounce free pardon to them all</div>
                              <div class="line">That will forsake thee and go home in peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">What say ye, countrymen? will ye relent,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yield to mercy whilst 'tis offer'd you;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or let a rebel lead you to your deaths?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who loves the king and will embrace his pardon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fling up his cap, and say 'God save his majesty!'</div>
                              <div class="line">Who hateth him and honours not his father,</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry the Fifth, that made all France to quake,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shake he his weapon at us and pass by.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                              <div class="line">God save the king! God save the king!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">What, Buckingham and Clifford, are ye so brave? And</div>
                              <div class="line">you, base peasants, do ye believe him? will you</div>
                              <div class="line">needs be hanged with your pardons about your necks?</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath my sword therefore broke through London gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">that you should leave me at the White Hart in</div>
                              <div class="line">Southwark? I thought ye would never have given out</div>
                              <div class="line">these arms till you had recovered your ancient</div>
                              <div class="line">freedom: but you are all recreants and dastards,</div>
                              <div class="line">and delight to live in slavery to the nobility. Let</div>
                              <div class="line">them break your backs with burthens, take your</div>
                              <div class="line">houses over your heads, ravish your wives and</div>
                              <div class="line">daughters before your faces: for me, I will make</div>
                              <div class="line">shift for one; and so, God's curse light upon you</div>
                              <div class="line">all!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll follow Cade, we'll follow Cade!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Is Cade the son of Henry the Fifth,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thus you do exclaim you'll go with him?</div>
                              <div class="line">Will he conduct you through the heart of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make the meanest of you earls and dukes?</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, he hath no home, no place to fly to;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor knows he how to live but by the spoil,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless by robbing of your friends and us.</div>
                              <div class="line">Were't not a shame, that whilst you live at jar,</div>
                              <div class="line">The fearful French, whom you late vanquished,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should make a start o'er seas and vanquish you?</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks already in this civil broil</div>
                              <div class="line">I see them lording it in London streets,</div>
                              <div class="line">Crying 'Villiago!' unto all they meet.</div>
                              <div class="line">Better ten thousand base-born Cades miscarry</div>
                              <div class="line">Than you should stoop unto a Frenchman's mercy.</div>
                              <div class="line">To France, to France, and get what you have lost;</div>
                              <div class="line">Spare England, for it is your native coast;</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry hath money, you are strong and manly;</div>
                              <div class="line">God on our side, doubt not of victory.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                              <div class="line">A Clifford! a Clifford! we'll follow the king and Clifford.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Was ever feather so lightly blown to and fro as this</div>
                              <div class="line">multitude? The name of Henry the Fifth hales them</div>
                              <div class="line">to an hundred mischiefs, and makes them leave me</div>
                              <div class="line">desolate. I see them lay their heads together to</div>
                              <div class="line">surprise me. My sword make way for me, for here is</div>
                              <div class="line">no staying. In despite of the devils and hell, have</div>
                              <div class="line">through the very middest of you? and heavens and</div>
                              <div class="line">honour be witness, that no want of resolution in me.</div>
                              <div class="line">but only my followers' base and ignominious</div>
                              <div class="line">treasons, makes me betake me to my heels.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">What, is he fled? Go some, and follow him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he that brings his head unto the king</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall have a thousand crowns for his reward.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt some of them</p>
                              <div class="line">Follow me, soldiers: we'll devise a mean</div>
                              <div class="line">To reconcile you all unto the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.10">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>9. SCENE IX.  Kenilworth Castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Sound Trumpets. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN
MARGARET, and SOMERSET, on the terrace</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Was ever king that joy'd an earthly throne,</div>
                              <div class="line">And could command no more content than I?</div>
                              <div class="line">No sooner was I crept out of my cradle</div>
                              <div class="line">But I was made a king, at nine months old.</div>
                              <div class="line">Was never subject long'd to be a king</div>
                              <div class="line">As I do long and wish to be a subject.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM and CLIFFORD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Health and glad tidings to your majesty!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, Buckingham, is the traitor Cade surprised?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or is he but retired to make him strong?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter below, multitudes, with halters about
their necks</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">He is fled, my lord, and all his powers do yield;</div>
                              <div class="line">And humbly thus, with halters on their necks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Expect your highness' doom of life or death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, heaven, set ope thy everlasting gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">To entertain my vows of thanks and praise!</div>
                              <div class="line">Soldiers, this day have you redeemed your lives,</div>
                              <div class="line">And show'd how well you love your prince and country:</div>
                              <div class="line">Continue still in this so good a mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Henry, though he be infortunate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Assure yourselves, will never be unkind:</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, with thanks and pardon to you all,</div>
                              <div class="line">I do dismiss you to your several countries.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                              <div class="line">God save the king! God save the king!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Please it your grace to be advertised</div>
                              <div class="line">The Duke of York is newly come from Ireland,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with a puissant and a mighty power</div>
                              <div class="line">Of gallowglasses and stout kerns</div>
                              <div class="line">Is marching hitherward in proud array,</div>
                              <div class="line">And still proclaimeth, as he comes along,</div>
                              <div class="line">His arms are only to remove from thee</div>
                              <div class="line">The Duke of Somerset, whom he terms traitor.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus stands my state, 'twixt Cade and York distress'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to a ship that, having 'scaped a tempest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is straightway calm'd and boarded with a pirate:</div>
                              <div class="line">But now is Cade driven back, his men dispersed;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now is York in arms to second him.</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, Buckingham, go and meet him,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ask him what's the reason of these arms.</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him I'll send Duke Edmund to the Tower;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, Somerset, we'll commit thee thither,</div>
                              <div class="line">Until his army be dismiss'd from him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll yield myself to prison willingly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or unto death, to do my country good.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">In any case, be not too rough in terms;</div>
                              <div class="line">For he is fierce and cannot brook hard language.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I will, my lord; and doubt not so to deal</div>
                              <div class="line">As all things shall redound unto your good.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, wife, let's in, and learn to govern better;</div>
                              <div class="line">For yet may England curse my wretched reign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish. Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.11">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>10. SCENE X.  Kent. IDEN's garden.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CADE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie on ambition! fie on myself, that have a sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">and yet am ready to famish! These five days have I</div>
                              <div class="line">hid me in these woods and durst not peep out, for</div>
                              <div class="line">all the country is laid for me; but now am I so</div>
                              <div class="line">hungry that if I might have a lease of my life for a</div>
                              <div class="line">thousand years I could stay no longer. Wherefore,</div>
                              <div class="line">on a brick wall have I climbed into this garden, to</div>
                              <div class="line">see if I can eat grass, or pick a sallet another</div>
                              <div class="line">while, which is not amiss to cool a man's stomach</div>
                              <div class="line">this hot weather. And I think this word 'sallet'</div>
                              <div class="line">was born to do me good: for many a time, but for a</div>
                              <div class="line">sallet, my brainpan had been cleft with a brown</div>
                              <div class="line">bill; and many a time, when I have been dry and</div>
                              <div class="line">bravely marching, it hath served me instead of a</div>
                              <div class="line">quart pot to drink in; and now the word 'sallet'</div>
                              <div class="line">must serve me to feed on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter IDEN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord, who would live turmoiled in the court,</div>
                              <div class="line">And may enjoy such quiet walks as these?</div>
                              <div class="line">This small inheritance my father left me</div>
                              <div class="line">Contenteth me, and worth a monarchy.</div>
                              <div class="line">I seek not to wax great by others' waning,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or gather wealth, I care not, with what envy:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sufficeth that I have maintains my state</div>
                              <div class="line">And sends the poor well pleased from my gate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's the lord of the soil come to seize me for a</div>
                              <div class="line">stray, for entering his fee-simple without leave.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, villain, thou wilt betray me, and get a thousand</div>
                              <div class="line">crowns of the king carrying my head to him: but</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll make thee eat iron like an ostrich, and swallow</div>
                              <div class="line">my sword like a great pin, ere thou and I part.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, rude companion, whatsoe'er thou be,</div>
                              <div class="line">I know thee not; why, then, should I betray thee?</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't not enough to break into my garden,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like a thief, to come to rob my grounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Climbing my walls in spite of me the owner,</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou wilt brave me with these saucy terms?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave thee! ay, by the best blood that ever was</div>
                              <div class="line">broached, and beard thee too. Look on me well: I</div>
                              <div class="line">have eat no meat these five days; yet, come thou and</div>
                              <div class="line">thy five men, and if I do not leave you all as dead</div>
                              <div class="line">as a doornail, I pray God I may never eat grass more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, it shall ne'er be said, while England stands,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Alexander Iden, an esquire of Kent,</div>
                              <div class="line">Took odds to combat a poor famish'd man.</div>
                              <div class="line">Oppose thy steadfast-gazing eyes to mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">See if thou canst outface me with thy looks:</div>
                              <div class="line">Set limb to limb, and thou art far the lesser;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy hand is but a finger to my fist,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy leg a stick compared with this truncheon;</div>
                              <div class="line">My foot shall fight with all the strength thou hast;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if mine arm be heaved in the air,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy grave is digg'd already in the earth.</div>
                              <div class="line">As for words, whose greatness answers words,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let this my sword report what speech forbears.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">By my valour, the most complete champion that ever I</div>
                              <div class="line">heard! Steel, if thou turn the edge, or cut not out</div>
                              <div class="line">the burly-boned clown in chines of beef ere thou</div>
                              <div class="line">sleep in thy sheath, I beseech God on my knees thou</div>
                              <div class="line">mayst be turned to hobnails.</div>
                              <p>Here they fight. CADE falls</p>
                              <div class="line">O, I am slain! famine and no other hath slain me:</div>
                              <div class="line">let ten thousand devils come against me, and give me</div>
                              <div class="line">but the ten meals I have lost, and I'll defy them</div>
                              <div class="line">all. Wither, garden; and be henceforth a</div>
                              <div class="line">burying-place to all that do dwell in this house,</div>
                              <div class="line">because the unconquered soul of Cade is fled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't Cade that I have slain, that monstrous traitor?</div>
                              <div class="line">Sword, I will hollow thee for this thy deed,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hang thee o'er my tomb when I am dead:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ne'er shall this blood be wiped from thy point;</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou shalt wear it as a herald's coat,</div>
                              <div class="line">To emblaze the honour that thy master got.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CADE</div>
                              <div class="line">Iden, farewell, and be proud of thy victory. Tell</div>
                              <div class="line">Kent from me, she hath lost her best man, and exhort</div>
                              <div class="line">all the world to be cowards; for I, that never</div>
                              <div class="line">feared any, am vanquished by famine, not by valour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">How much thou wrong'st me, heaven be my judge.</div>
                              <div class="line">Die, damned wretch, the curse of her that bare thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">And as I thrust thy body in with my sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">So wish I, I might thrust thy soul to hell.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hence will I drag thee headlong by the heels</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto a dunghill which shall be thy grave,</div>
                              <div class="line">And there cut off thy most ungracious head;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I will bear in triumph to the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Leaving thy trunk for crows to feed upon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Saint Alban's.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter YORK, and his army of Irish, with drum
and colours</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">From Ireland thus comes York to claim his right,</div>
                              <div class="line">And pluck the crown from feeble Henry's head:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ring, bells, aloud; burn, bonfires, clear and bright,</div>
                              <div class="line">To entertain great England's lawful king.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah! sancta majestas, who would not buy thee dear?</div>
                              <div class="line">Let them obey that know not how to rule;</div>
                              <div class="line">This hand was made to handle naught but gold.</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot give due action to my words,</div>
                              <div class="line">Except a sword or sceptre balance it:</div>
                              <div class="line">A sceptre shall it have, have I a soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">On which I'll toss the flower-de-luce of France.</div>
                              <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM</p>
                              <div class="line">Whom have we here? Buckingham, to disturb me?</div>
                              <div class="line">The king hath sent him, sure: I must dissemble.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">York, if thou meanest well, I greet thee well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Humphrey of Buckingham, I accept thy greeting.</div>
                              <div class="line">Art thou a messenger, or come of pleasure?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">A messenger from Henry, our dread liege,</div>
                              <div class="line">To know the reason of these arms in peace;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or why thou, being a subject as I am,</div>
                              <div class="line">Against thy oath and true allegiance sworn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should raise so great a power without his leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or dare to bring thy force so near the court.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Scarce can I speak, my choler is so great:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, I could hew up rocks and fight with flint,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am so angry at these abject terms;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now, like Ajax Telamonius,</div>
                              <div class="line">On sheep or oxen could I spend my fury.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am far better born than is the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">More like a king, more kingly in my thoughts:</div>
                              <div class="line">But I must make fair weather yet a while,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till Henry be more weak and I more strong,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Buckingham, I prithee, pardon me,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I have given no answer all this while;</div>
                              <div class="line">My mind was troubled with deep melancholy.</div>
                              <div class="line">The cause why I have brought this army hither</div>
                              <div class="line">Is to remove proud Somerset from the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seditious to his grace and to the state.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">That is too much presumption on thy part:</div>
                              <div class="line">But if thy arms be to no other end,</div>
                              <div class="line">The king hath yielded unto thy demand:</div>
                              <div class="line">The Duke of Somerset is in the Tower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon thine honour, is he prisoner?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon mine honour, he is prisoner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, Buckingham, I do dismiss my powers.</div>
                              <div class="line">Soldiers, I thank you all; disperse yourselves;</div>
                              <div class="line">Meet me to-morrow in St. George's field,</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall have pay and every thing you wish.</div>
                              <div class="line">And let my sovereign, virtuous Henry,</div>
                              <div class="line">Command my eldest son, nay, all my sons,</div>
                              <div class="line">As pledges of my fealty and love;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll send them all as willing as I live:</div>
                              <div class="line">Lands, goods, horse, armour, any thing I have,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is his to use, so Somerset may die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">York, I commend this kind submission:</div>
                              <div class="line">We twain will go into his highness' tent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter KING HENRY VI and Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Buckingham, doth York intend no harm to us,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thus he marcheth with thee arm in arm?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">In all submission and humility</div>
                              <div class="line">York doth present himself unto your highness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Then what intends these forces thou dost bring?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">To heave the traitor Somerset from hence,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fight against that monstrous rebel Cade,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who since I heard to be discomfited.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter IDEN, with CADE'S head</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">If one so rude and of so mean condition</div>
                              <div class="line">May pass into the presence of a king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, I present your grace a traitor's head,</div>
                              <div class="line">The head of Cade, whom I in combat slew.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">The head of Cade! Great God, how just art Thou!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let me view his visage, being dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">That living wrought me such exceeding trouble.</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me, my friend, art thou the man that slew him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">I was, an't like your majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">How art thou call'd? and what is thy degree?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">Alexander Iden, that's my name;</div>
                              <div class="line">A poor esquire of Kent, that loves his king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">So please it you, my lord, 'twere not amiss</div>
                              <div class="line">He were created knight for his good service.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Iden, kneel down.</div>
                              <p>He kneels</p>
                              <div class="line">Rise up a knight.</div>
                              <div class="line">We give thee for reward a thousand marks,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will that thou henceforth attend on us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">IDEN</div>
                              <div class="line">May Iden live to merit such a bounty.</div>
                              <div class="line">And never live but true unto his liege!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Rises</p>
                        <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET and SOMERSET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">See, Buckingham, Somerset comes with the queen:</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, bid her hide him quickly from the duke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">For thousand Yorks he shall not hide his head,</div>
                              <div class="line">But boldly stand and front him to his face.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">How now! is Somerset at liberty?</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, York, unloose thy long-imprison'd thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let thy tongue be equal with thy heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I endure the sight of Somerset?</div>
                              <div class="line">False king! why hast thou broken faith with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Knowing how hardly I can brook abuse?</div>
                              <div class="line">King did I call thee? no, thou art not king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not fit to govern and rule multitudes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which darest not, no, nor canst not rule a traitor.</div>
                              <div class="line">That head of thine doth not become a crown;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy hand is made to grasp a palmer's staff,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not to grace an awful princely sceptre.</div>
                              <div class="line">That gold must round engirt these brows of mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose smile and frown, like to Achilles' spear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is able with the change to kill and cure.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is a hand to hold a sceptre up</div>
                              <div class="line">And with the same to act controlling laws.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give place: by heaven, thou shalt rule no more</div>
                              <div class="line">O'er him whom heaven created for thy ruler.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">O monstrous traitor! I arrest thee, York,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of capital treason 'gainst the king and crown;</div>
                              <div class="line">Obey, audacious traitor; kneel for grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Wouldst have me kneel? first let me ask of these,</div>
                              <div class="line">If they can brook I bow a knee to man.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, call in my sons to be my bail;</div>
                              <p>Exit Attendant</p>
                              <div class="line">I know, ere they will have me go to ward,</div>
                              <div class="line">They'll pawn their swords for my enfranchisement.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Call hither Clifford! bid him come amain,</div>
                              <div class="line">To say if that the bastard boys of York</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall be the surety for their traitor father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit BUCKINGHAM</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">O blood-besotted Neapolitan,</div>
                              <div class="line">Outcast of Naples, England's bloody scourge!</div>
                              <div class="line">The sons of York, thy betters in their birth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall be their father's bail; and bane to those</div>
                              <div class="line">That for my surety will refuse the boys!</div>
                              <p>Enter EDWARD and RICHARD</p>
                              <div class="line">See where they come: I'll warrant they'll</div>
                              <div class="line">make it good.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CLIFFORD and YOUNG CLIFFORD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And here comes Clifford to deny their bail.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Health and all happiness to my lord the king!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Kneels</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee, Clifford: say, what news with thee?</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, do not fright us with an angry look;</div>
                              <div class="line">We are thy sovereign, Clifford, kneel again;</div>
                              <div class="line">For thy mistaking so, we pardon thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">This is my king, York, I do not mistake;</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou mistakest me much to think I do:</div>
                              <div class="line">To Bedlam with him! is the man grown mad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, Clifford; a bedlam and ambitious humour</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes him oppose himself against his king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">He is a traitor; let him to the Tower,</div>
                              <div class="line">And chop away that factious pate of his.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">He is arrested, but will not obey;</div>
                              <div class="line">His sons, he says, shall give their words for him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you not, sons?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, noble father, if our words will serve.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">And if words will not, then our weapons shall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what a brood of traitors have we here!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Look in a glass, and call thy image so:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am thy king, and thou a false-heart traitor.</div>
                              <div class="line">Call hither to the stake my two brave bears,</div>
                              <div class="line">That with the very shaking of their chains</div>
                              <div class="line">They may astonish these fell-lurking curs:</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid Salisbury and Warwick come to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the WARWICK and SALISBURY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Are these thy bears? we'll bait thy bears to death.</div>
                              <div class="line">And manacle the bear-ward in their chains,</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou darest bring them to the baiting place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Oft have I seen a hot o'erweening cur</div>
                              <div class="line">Run back and bite, because he was withheld;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, being suffer'd with the bear's fell paw,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath clapp'd his tail between his legs and cried:</div>
                              <div class="line">And such a piece of service will you do,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you oppose yourselves to match Lord Warwick.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Hence, heap of wrath, foul indigested lump,</div>
                              <div class="line">As crooked in thy manners as thy shape!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, we shall heat you thoroughly anon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Take heed, lest by your heat you burn yourselves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, Warwick, hath thy knee forgot to bow?</div>
                              <div class="line">Old Salisbury, shame to thy silver hair,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou mad misleader of thy brain-sick son!</div>
                              <div class="line">What, wilt thou on thy death-bed play the ruffian,</div>
                              <div class="line">And seek for sorrow with thy spectacles?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, where is faith? O, where is loyalty?</div>
                              <div class="line">If it be banish'd from the frosty head,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where shall it find a harbour in the earth?</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou go dig a grave to find out war,</div>
                              <div class="line">And shame thine honourable age with blood?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why art thou old, and want'st experience?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or wherefore dost abuse it, if thou hast it?</div>
                              <div class="line">For shame! in duty bend thy knee to me</div>
                              <div class="line">That bows unto the grave with mickle age.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I have consider'd with myself</div>
                              <div class="line">The title of this most renowned duke;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in my conscience do repute his grace</div>
                              <div class="line">The rightful heir to England's royal seat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast thou not sworn allegiance unto me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">I have.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Canst thou dispense with heaven for such an oath?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">It is great sin to swear unto a sin,</div>
                              <div class="line">But greater sin to keep a sinful oath.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who can be bound by any solemn vow</div>
                              <div class="line">To do a murderous deed, to rob a man,</div>
                              <div class="line">To force a spotless virgin's chastity,</div>
                              <div class="line">To reave the orphan of his patrimony,</div>
                              <div class="line">To wring the widow from her custom'd right,</div>
                              <div class="line">And have no other reason for this wrong</div>
                              <div class="line">But that he was bound by a solemn oath?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">A subtle traitor needs no sophister.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Call Buckingham, and bid him arm himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Call Buckingham, and all the friends thou hast,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am resolved for death or dignity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">The first I warrant thee, if dreams prove true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">You were best to go to bed and dream again,</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep thee from the tempest of the field.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">I am resolved to bear a greater storm</div>
                              <div class="line">Than any thou canst conjure up to-day;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that I'll write upon thy burgonet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Might I but know thee by thy household badge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by my father's badge, old Nevil's crest,</div>
                              <div class="line">The rampant bear chain'd to the ragged staff,</div>
                              <div class="line">This day I'll wear aloft my burgonet,</div>
                              <div class="line">As on a mountain top the cedar shows</div>
                              <div class="line">That keeps his leaves in spite of any storm,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even to affright thee with the view thereof.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">And from thy burgonet I'll rend thy bear</div>
                              <div class="line">And tread it under foot with all contempt,</div>
                              <div class="line">Despite the bear-ward that protects the bear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YOUNG CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">And so to arms, victorious father,</div>
                              <div class="line">To quell the rebels and their complices.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie! charity, for shame! speak not in spite,</div>
                              <div class="line">For you shall sup with Jesu Christ to-night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YOUNG CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Foul stigmatic, that's more than thou canst tell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">If not in heaven, you'll surely sup in hell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt severally</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Saint Alban's.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarums to the battle. Enter WARWICK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Clifford of Cumberland, 'tis Warwick calls:</div>
                              <div class="line">And if thou dost not hide thee from the bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, when the angry trumpet sounds alarum</div>
                              <div class="line">And dead men's cries do fill the empty air,</div>
                              <div class="line">Clifford, I say, come forth and fight with me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Proud northern lord, Clifford of Cumberland,</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick is hoarse with calling thee to arms.</div>
                              <p>Enter YORK</p>
                              <div class="line">How now, my noble lord? what, all afoot?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">The deadly-handed Clifford slew my steed,</div>
                              <div class="line">But match to match I have encounter'd him</div>
                              <div class="line">And made a prey for carrion kites and crows</div>
                              <div class="line">Even of the bonny beast he loved so well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CLIFFORD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Of one or both of us the time is come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold, Warwick, seek thee out some other chase,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I myself must hunt this deer to death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, nobly, York; 'tis for a crown thou fight'st.</div>
                              <div class="line">As I intend, Clifford, to thrive to-day,</div>
                              <div class="line">It grieves my soul to leave thee unassail'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">What seest thou in me, York? why dost thou pause?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">With thy brave bearing should I be in love,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that thou art so fast mine enemy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor should thy prowess want praise and esteem,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that 'tis shown ignobly and in treason.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">So let it help me now against thy sword</div>
                              <div class="line">As I in justice and true right express it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul and body on the action both!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">A dreadful lay! Address thee instantly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They fight, and CLIFFORD falls</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">La fin couronne les oeuvres.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus war hath given thee peace, for thou art still.</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace with his soul, heaven, if it be thy will!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Enter YOUNG CLIFFORD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YOUNG CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Shame and confusion! all is on the rout;</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear frames disorder, and disorder wounds</div>
                              <div class="line">Where it should guard. O war, thou son of hell,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom angry heavens do make their minister</div>
                              <div class="line">Throw in the frozen bosoms of our part</div>
                              <div class="line">Hot coals of vengeance! Let no soldier fly.</div>
                              <div class="line">He that is truly dedicate to war</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath no self-love, nor he that loves himself</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath not essentially but by circumstance</div>
                              <div class="line">The name of valour.</div>
                              <p>Seeing his dead father</p>
                              <div class="line">O, let the vile world end,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the premised flames of the last day</div>
                              <div class="line">Knit earth and heaven together!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now let the general trumpet blow his blast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Particularities and petty sounds</div>
                              <div class="line">To cease! Wast thou ordain'd, dear father,</div>
                              <div class="line">To lose thy youth in peace, and to achieve</div>
                              <div class="line">The silver livery of advised age,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in thy reverence and thy chair-days, thus</div>
                              <div class="line">To die in ruffian battle? Even at this sight</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart is turn'd to stone: and while 'tis mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be stony. York not our old men spares;</div>
                              <div class="line">No more will I their babes: tears virginal</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall be to me even as the dew to fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">And beauty that the tyrant oft reclaims</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall to my flaming wrath be oil and flax.</div>
                              <div class="line">Henceforth I will not have to do with pity:</div>
                              <div class="line">Meet I an infant of the house of York,</div>
                              <div class="line">Into as many gobbets will I cut it</div>
                              <div class="line">As wild Medea young Absyrtus did:</div>
                              <div class="line">In cruelty will I seek out my fame.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, thou new ruin of old Clifford's house:</div>
                              <div class="line">As did AEneas old Anchises bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">So bear I thee upon my manly shoulders;</div>
                              <div class="line">But then AEneas bare a living load,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing so heavy as these woes of mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit, bearing off his father</p>
                        <p>Enter RICHARD and SOMERSET to fight. SOMERSET
is killed</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">So, lie thou there;</div>
                              <div class="line">For underneath an alehouse' paltry sign,</div>
                              <div class="line">The Castle in Saint Alban's, Somerset</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath made the wizard famous in his death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sword, hold thy temper; heart, be wrathful still:</div>
                              <div class="line">Priests pray for enemies, but princes kill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
